name: absolute
trans: n. 绝对；绝对事物

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: absorb
trans: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: abstract
trans: n. 摘要；抽象；抽象的概念

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: academic
trans: n. 大学生，大学教师；学者

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

name: accent
trans: n. 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

name: acceptable
trans: adj. 可接受的；合意的；可忍受的

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

name: accidentally
trans: adv. 意外地；偶然地

sentences.english: She accidentally erased the tape.
sentences.chinese: 她意外地抹去了录了音的磁带。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that was not planned or intended deliberately

name: accommodate
trans: vi. 适应；调解

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: accompany
trans: vt. 陪伴，伴随；伴奏

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: accomplish
trans: vt. 完成；实现；达到

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: account
trans: n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: accountant
trans: n. 会计师；会计人员

sentences.english: The boss dropped an accountant from the payroll.
sentences.chinese: 老板把一名会计师从在职人员名单中除了名。

sentences.english: The accountant checked this unnecessary spending in good time.
sentences.chinese: 会计及时卡住了这笔不必要的开支。

sentences.english: They conferred with the accountant vis-à-vis the proposed budget.
sentences.chinese: 他们与会计商量有关预算提案的事。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes etc

name: accuracy
trans: n. [数] 精确度，准确性

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: accurate
trans: adj. 精确的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: accurately
trans: adv. 精确地，准确地

sentences.english: I can't render my thought accurately.
sentences.chinese: 我不能将我的思想准确地表达出来。

sentences.english: We should train our students to speak English fluently and accurately.
sentences.chinese: 我们应培养学生流利而准确地讲英语。

name: accuse
trans: vt. 控告，指控；谴责；归咎于

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: acid
trans: n. 酸；<俚>迷幻药

sentences.english: sulphuric acid
sentences.chinese: 硫酸

sentences.english: a juicy apple with a slightly acid flavour
sentences.chinese: 一个多汁、略带酸味的苹果

sentences.english: I was expecting another of his acid remarks, but he remained silent.
sentences.chinese: 我等着他再说一句刻薄的话，但他不吭声了。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that has a  pH  of less than 7. Strong acids can burn holes in material or damage your skin
having a sharp sour taste

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: acquire
trans: vt. 获得；取得；学到；捕获

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: activate
trans: vt. 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

name: actual
trans: adj. 真实的，实际的；现行的，目前的

sentences.english: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
sentences.chinese: 我没开玩笑，那都是他的原话。

sentences.english: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
sentences.chinese: 我知道德国队胜了，但我不知道确切的比分。

sentences.english: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 利息只按实际借款额收取。

sentences.english: In actual fact (= really  ) , there is little evidence to support the allegations.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些指控几乎没有证据支持。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

name: adapt
trans: vi. 适应

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: addiction
trans: n. 上瘾，沉溺；癖嗜

sentences.english: She helped him fight his drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 她帮助了他对抗自己的毒瘾。

detailed_translations.english: the need to take a harmful drug regularly, without being able to stop

name: additional
trans: adj. 附加的，额外的

sentences.english: Additional information can be obtained from the centre.
sentences.chinese: 可以从中心获取更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: more than what was agreed or expected

name: additionally
trans: adv. 此外；又，加之

sentences.english: A new contract is in place. Additionally, staff will be offered a bonus scheme.
sentences.chinese: 新合同已经准备就绪。 除此之外，还将给员工设立一个奖金计划。

detailed_translations.english: in addition

name: address
trans: n. 地址；演讲；致辞；说话的技巧；称呼

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: adequate
trans: adj. 充足的；适当的；胜任的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: adequately
trans: adv. 充分地；足够地；适当地

sentences.english: They had equipped their workers adequately for such dangerous condition.
sentences.chinese: 他们让工人们充分装备起来， 以应付这样的危险情况。

sentences.english: I provided some teaser output, but this was not sufficently extensive nor well organized so that you could adequately interpret the results of the analysis.
sentences.chinese: 我提供了一些难处理的输出，但是这既不够充分也没进行很好的组织，以致您无法充分地解释分析结果。

name: adjust
trans: vt. 调整，使…适合；校准

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

name: administration
trans: n. 管理；行政；实施；行政机构

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with experience in administration.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻找一个有管理经验的人。

sentences.english: The health service spends too much on administration.
sentences.chinese: 医疗服务部门在行政方面花费太多。

detailed_translations.english: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization

name: adopt
trans: vi. 采取；过继

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: advance
trans: n. 发展；前进；增长；预付款

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: affair
trans: n. 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: affordable
trans: adj. 负担得起的

sentences.english: ...the availability of affordable housing.
sentences.chinese: …多数人支付得起的房产的供应。

detailed_translations.english: If something is affordable, most people have enough money to buy it

name: afterwards
trans: adv. 后来；然后

sentences.english: Charles arrived shortly afterwards .
sentences.chinese: 过了不多久，查尔斯来了。

sentences.english: She died not long afterwards .
sentences.chinese: 不久以后她去世了。

sentences.english: Afterwards, I was asked to write a book.
sentences.chinese: 后来，有人要我写一本书。

detailed_translations.english: after an event or time that has already been mentioned

name: agency
trans: n. 代理，中介；代理处，经销处

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

name: agenda
trans: n. 议程；日常工作事项；日程表

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: agriculture
trans: n. 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学

sentences.english: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

name: aid
trans: n. 援助；帮助；助手；帮助者

sentences.english: He was breathing only with the aid of a ventilator.
sentences.chinese: 他只有靠呼吸器呼吸。

sentences.english: first aid
sentences.chinese: 急救；急救护理

detailed_translations.english: help that you need to do a particular thing

name: AIDS
trans: abbr. 获得性免疫缺乏综合征；爱滋病（Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome）

sentences.english: the AIDS virus
sentences.chinese: 艾滋病病毒

sentences.english: Aids sufferers
sentences.chinese: 艾滋病患者

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["AIDS at its most advanced stage"],"COLLOINEXA":["full-blown AIDS"]}
sentences.chinese: 完全型艾滋病

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease that stops your body from defending itself against infections, and usually causes death

name: aircraft
trans: n. 飞机，航空器

sentences.english: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的返回航程被推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: a plane or other vehicle that can fly

name: alarm
trans: n. 闹钟；警报，警告器；惊慌

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: alien
trans: n. 外国人，外侨；外星人

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: alongside
trans: prep. 在……旁边

sentences.english: A car drew up alongside .
sentences.chinese: 一辆车在旁边停了下来。

sentences.english: Children’s prices are shown alongside adult prices.
sentences.chinese: 儿童票价标在成人票价旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to the side of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…旁边， 沿着…的边； 和…在一起

name: alter
trans: vt. 改变，更改

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: altogether
trans: n. 整个；裸体

sentences.english: an old custom that has vanished altogether
sentences.chinese: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗

sentences.english: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
sentences.chinese: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
not wearing any clothes – used humorously

name: ambulance
trans: n. [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院
detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

name: amount
trans: n. 数量；总额，总数

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

name: amusing
trans: adj. 有趣的，好玩的；引人发笑的

sentences.english: I don’t find his jokes at all amusing .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他的笑话一点都不好笑。

sentences.english: a highly amusing (=  very amusing  ) film
sentences.chinese: 非常有趣的电影

detailed_translations.english: funny and entertaining

name: analyst
trans: n. 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者

sentences.english: Political analysts expect the Conservatives to win.
sentences.chinese: 政治分析家预计保守党获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to think about something carefully in order to understand it, and often to advise other people about it

name: ancestor
trans: n. 始祖，祖先；被继承人

sentences.chinese: 我的祖先是法国人。

detailed_translations.english: a member of your family who lived a long time ago

trans: n. 怒，愤怒；忿怒

sentences.chinese: 民众对政府越来越不满。

sentences.english: What angered me most was his total lack of remorse.
sentences.chinese: 最让我生气的是他居然毫无悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of wanting to hurt or criticize someone because they have done something bad to you or been unkind to you
to make someone angry

name: angle
trans: n. 角度，角，方面

sentences.english: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
sentences.chinese: 你没有量准角度。

detailed_translations.english: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

name: animation
trans: n. 活泼，生气；激励；卡通片绘制

sentences.english: 3-D animations
sentences.chinese: 三维动画片

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼，生气；激励；卡通片绘制
detailed_translations.english: liveliness and excitement

name: anniversary
trans: n. 周年纪念日

sentences.english: Jack and Kim celebrated their twentieth wedding anniversary in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月，杰克和金庆祝了他们的结婚20周年纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

name: annual
trans: n. 年刊，年鉴；一年生植物

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: annually
trans: adv. 每年；一年一次

sentences.english: This is a perennating rhizome from which flowering shoots arise annually.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种每年发芽开花的多年生根茎。

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: anxiety
trans: n. 焦虑；渴望；挂念；令人焦虑的事

sentences.english: his feelings of anxiety
sentences.chinese: 他焦虑的心情

sentences.english: A high level of anxiety was created by the introduction of cameras into the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工厂安装了摄像头，这引起了工人的高度不安。

sentences.english: It can help if you discuss your anxieties with someone.
sentences.chinese: 与别人谈谈自己的忧虑会有帮助的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being very worried about something

name: anxious
trans: adj. 焦虑的；担忧的；渴望的；急切的

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: apology
trans: n. 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物

sentences.english: Edward can’t be here today, but he sends his apologies .
sentences.chinese: 爱德华今天来不了，他向大家表示歉意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

name: apparent
trans: adj. 显然的；表面上的

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: apparently
trans: adv. 显然地；似乎，表面上

sentences.english: But apparently this is only an illusion.
sentences.chinese: 但显然这只是一个错觉。

sentences.english: The news had apparently been aimed at stealing the thunder from his visit.
sentences.chinese: 这篇新闻显然是在对他的访问作先声夺人的报道。

sentences.english: But if you were so inclined, apparently all you have to do work on the railroad.
sentences.chinese: 不过，如果你有这种想法的话，显然你所需要做的就是——去铁路局工作。

name: appeal
trans: n. 呼吁，请求；吸引力，感染力；上诉；诉诸裁判

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

name: applicant
trans: n. 申请人，申请者；请求者

sentences.english: We have had lots of applicants for these positions.
sentences.chinese: 对这些职位我们已有了很多申请人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

name: approach
trans: n. 方法；途径；接近

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: appropriate
trans: adj. 适当的；恰当的；合适的

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: appropriately
trans: adv. 适当地；合适地；相称地

sentences.english: Try to dress appropriately for each occasion.
sentences.chinese: 试图为每个场合适当地打扮。

sentences.english: Do we have any means to align our research appropriately with our understanding of those risks?
sentences.chinese: 我们是否有可能根据对这些风险的理解来适当地调整我们的研究方向呢？

name: approval
trans: n. 批准；认可；赞成

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

name: approve
trans: vi. 批准；赞成；满意

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: arise
trans: vi. 出现；上升；起立

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: armed
trans: adj. 武装的；有扶手的；有防卫器官的（指动物）

name: arms
trans: n. 臂（arm的复数）；[军] 武器；纹章

name: arrow
trans: n. 箭，箭头；箭状物；箭头记号

sentences.english: Follow the arrows to the X-ray department.
sentences.chinese: 顺着箭头指示的方向去X光科。

detailed_translations.chinese: 箭，箭头；箭状物；箭头记号
detailed_translations.english: a weapon usually made from a thin straight piece of wood with a sharp point at one end, that you shoot with a  bow

detailed_translations.chinese: 以箭头指示；箭一般地飞向

name: artificial
trans: adj. 人造的；仿造的；虚伪的；非原产地的；武断的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: artistic
trans: adj. 艺术的；风雅的；有美感的

sentences.english: artistic work
sentences.chinese: 艺术作品

sentences.english: Opinion about the artistic merit of his paintings has been mixed.
sentences.chinese: 对于他的绘画作品的艺术价值，人们褒贬不一。

detailed_translations.english: relating to art or culture

name: artwork
trans: n. 艺术品；插图；美术品

sentences.english: The museum contains 6,000 contemporary and modern artworks.
sentences.chinese: 该博物馆藏有6000件现当代艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: paintings and other objects produced by artists

trans: adj. 惭愧的，感到难为情的；耻于……的

sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: aside
trans: prep. 在…旁边

sentences.english: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
sentences.chinese: 他推开吃了一半的色拉走了。

sentences.english: He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
sentences.chinese: 他站到一边让凯瑟琳先进去。

sentences.english: Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.english: She swept her thick hair aside.
sentences.chinese: 她把浓密的头发梳到一边。

detailed_translations.english: moved to one side or away from you

name: aspect
trans: n. 方面；方向；形势；外貌

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: assess
trans: vt. 评定；估价；对…征税

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论

name: assessment
trans: n. 评定；估价

sentences.english: a reading assessment test
sentences.chinese: 阅读评估测试

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you make a judgment about a person or situation, or the judgment you make

name: asset
trans: n. 资产；优点；有用的东西；有利条件；财产；有价值的人或物

sentences.english: the value of a company’s assets
sentences.chinese: 公司的资产价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 资产， 财产； 有价值的特性或技能， 优点
detailed_translations.english: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

name: assign
trans: vt. 分配；指派；[计][数] 赋值

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: assistance
trans: n. 援助，帮助；辅助设备

sentences.english: We offer financial assistance to students.
sentences.chinese: 我们向学生提供经济援助。

sentences.english: Can I be of any assistance (=  can I help you  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 我能帮什么忙吗？

detailed_translations.english: help or support

name: associate
trans: n. 同事，伙伴；关联的事物

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
detailed_translations.english: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with

name: associated
trans: v. 联系（associate的过去式和过去分词）

name: association
trans: n. 协会，联盟，社团；联合；联想

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

name: assume
trans: vt. 僭取；篡夺；夺取；擅用；侵占

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: assumption
trans: n. 假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: assure
trans: vt. 保证；担保；使确信；弄清楚

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: astonishing
trans: adj. 惊人的；令人惊讶的

sentences.english: an astonishing decision
sentences.chinese: 令人惊讶的决定

sentences.english: their astonishing success
sentences.chinese: 他们惊人的成功

detailed_translations.english: so surprising that it is difficult to believe

name: attachment
trans: n. 附件；依恋；连接物；扣押财产

sentences.english: a child’s attachment to its mother
sentences.chinese: 孩子对母亲的依恋

sentences.english: The vacuum cleaner has various attachments.
sentences.chinese: 这台真空吸尘器有各种附件。

sentences.english: the attachments that secure your boots firmly to the skis
sentences.chinese: 把靴子牢牢固定在滑雪板上的扣件

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you like or love someone or something and that you would be unhappy without them

name: attempt
trans: n. 企图，试图；攻击

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

name: auction
trans: n. 拍卖

sentences.english: Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week.
sentences.chinese: 法国艺术家让·科克托的8幅画作将在下周拍卖。

detailed_translations.english: to sell something at an auction
a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

name: audio
trans: adj. 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的

sentences.english: audio and video equipment
sentences.chinese: 音频视频设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

name: automatic
trans: n. 自动机械；自动手枪

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: automatically
trans: adj. 不经思索的

sentences.english: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
sentences.chinese: 现在加入，立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

detailed_translations.english: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more

name: awareness
trans: n. 意识，认识；明白，知道

sentences.english: Health officials have tried to raise awareness (=  improve people’s knowledge  ) about AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

name: awkward
trans: adj. 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: back
trans: n. 后面；背部；靠背；足球等的后卫；书报等的末尾

sentences.english: I’ll be back in a minute.
sentences.chinese: 我马上回来。

sentences.english: Put that book back where you found it!
sentences.chinese: 把那本书放回原处！

sentences.english: He was back home by half past eleven.
sentences.chinese: 他是11点半之前回家的。

sentences.english: It’s possible to travel there and back in a day.
sentences.chinese: 到那里一天来回是可以的。

sentences.english: Kirov stepped back a pace.
sentences.chinese: 基洛夫往后退了一步。

detailed_translations.english: in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before

name: bacteria
trans: n. [微] 细菌

sentences.english: Some of these bacteria are actually good for you.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

detailed_translations.english: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

name: badge
trans: n. 徽章；证章；标记

sentences.english: We were each handed a badge with our name on it.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个人都拿到一个徽章，上面有我们的名字。

sentences.english: He now sees his wartime injuries as a badge of honor.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他把自己在战争中受的伤看成是一种光荣标记。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of metal or plastic, with a design or words on it, that a person wears to show that they belong to an organization, support sth, have achieved sth, have a particular rank, etc.

name: balanced
trans: adj. 平衡的；和谐的；安定的

name: ballet
trans: n. 芭蕾舞剧；芭蕾舞乐曲

sentences.english: She wants to be a ballet dancer .
sentences.chinese: 她想当芭蕾舞演员。

name: balloon
trans: n. 气球

sentences.chinese: 大众酒吧间里人很多。

sentences.english: a candy bar
sentences.chinese: 一根糖果棒

sentences.english: houses with bars across the windows
sentences.chinese: 窗户上钉有铁条的房屋

name: barely
trans: adv. 仅仅，勉强；几乎不；公开地；贫乏地

sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

trans: n. 交易；便宜货；契约

sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线

sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: basement
trans: n. 地下室；地窖

sentences.chinese: 他们买了座旧校舍居住，还在地下室建了个作坊。

trans: adv. 主要地，基本上

sentences.chinese: 说穿了，我就是懒。

sentences.english: Well, basically, it’s a matter of filling in a few forms.

sentences.chinese: 基本上，我以前每天晚上都见他。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize the most important reason or fact about something, or a simple explanation of something

name: basket
trans: n. 篮子；（篮球比赛的）得分；一篮之量；篮筐

sentences.english: a shopping basket
sentences.chinese: 购物篮

sentences.english: a basket full of vegetables
sentences.chinese: 装满蔬菜的篮子

detailed_translations.chinese: 篮子；（篮球比赛的）得分；一篮之量；篮筐
detailed_translations.english: a container made of thin pieces of plastic, wire, or wood woven together, used to carry things or put things in

name: bat
trans: n. 蝙蝠；球棒；球拍；批处理文件的扩展名

sentences.english: A bat echolocates the direction.
sentences.chinese: 蝙蝠凭回声测定方向。

sentences.english: Having been suggested by a bat, people invented sonar.
sentences.chinese: 受到蝙蝠的启发，人们发明了声呐。

sentences.english: It is technically incorrect to talk about bat ‘radar’, since they do not use radio waves.
sentences.chinese: 严密来说，说蝙蝠有“雷达”系统是错误的，因为他们并不使用无线电波。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal like a mouse with wings that flies around at night

name: battle
trans: n. 战役；斗争

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

name: bear
trans: n. 熊

sentences.english: a mother bear and her cubs
sentences.chinese: 母熊和它的熊崽们

detailed_translations.english: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

name: beat
trans: n. 拍子；敲击；有规律的一连串敲打

sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

trans: vi. 乞讨；请求

sentences.chinese: 她突然很想冲上去请求他原谅，但是她忍住了。

name: being
trans: n. 存在；生命；本质；品格

sentences.english: human beings
sentences.chinese: 人

detailed_translations.english: existence

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

sentences.chinese: 弯曲的钉子

sentences.chinese: 双膝微曲站立。

sentences.english: He breathed in deeply, bent double in pain (=  with the top part of your body leaning forward towards your legs  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他深深地吸着气，痛得直不起腰来。

sentences.english: a bent old man (=  not standing straight  )

no longer straight

sentences.chinese: 温迪走过来，坐在我身边。

sentences.english: the table beside the bed

sentences.english: I was standing right beside her at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我就站在她的旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

name: besides
trans: prep. 除…之外

sentences.chinese: 我需要这笔钱，而且，我一旦答应做什么事情就会做到。

sentences.english: The area has stunning scenery, beautiful beaches, and much more besides.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有迷人的景色、美丽的沙滩，除此之外还有很多很多。

name: bet
trans: n. 打赌，赌注；被打赌的事物

sentences.english: How much do you want to bet?
sentences.chinese: 你想赌多少钱？

sentences.english: a £50 bet
sentences.chinese: 50英镑的赌注

an agreement to risk money on the result of a race, game etc or on something happening, or the money that you risk

name: beyond
trans: prep. 超过；越过；那一边；在...较远的一边

sentences.chinese: 他们翻过山，向更远处的山谷进发。

sentences.english: Beyond the river, cattle were grazing.
sentences.chinese: 河的那边，牛在吃草。

sentences.english: She drove through Westport, and stopped a few miles beyond at a wayside inn.
sentences.chinese: 她驱车穿过西港，在几英里外的一个路边旅馆停了下来。

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.

sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

sentences.chinese: 抑郁症与生理和心理都有关系。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the natural processes performed by living things

sentences.chinese: 医生们认为他会失明。

sentences.english: blind faith/obedience
sentences.chinese: 盲目的信念；盲从

detailed_translations.english: not able to see

name: blow
trans: n. 吹；打击；殴打

sentences.chinese: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.chinese: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.english: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.chinese: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.english: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.english: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

name: bombing
trans: n. [军] 轰炸，[军] 投弹

name: bond
trans: n. 债券；结合；约定；粘合剂；纽带

sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

name: booking
trans: n. 预订；预约；演出契约

sentences.chinese: 预订游船船位

sentences.chinese: 我预订了两个双人房间。

sentences.english: I’m calling to confirm my booking (=  say definitely that I want to travel etc  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我打电话是想确认一下我的预订。

sentences.chinese: 如果你取消预订，就要付一小额费用。

sentences.english: Places on the course are limited and advance booking is essential.

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement to travel by train, use a hotel room etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: border
trans: n. 边境；边界；国界

sentences.english: countries that border the Mediterranean
sentences.chinese: 地中海沿岸的国家

sentences.english: ...the European and Arab countries bordering the Mediterranean.
sentences.chinese: …地中海沿岸的欧洲国家和阿拉伯国家。

detailed_translations.english: if one country, state, or area borders another, it is next to it and shares a border with it

A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it

name: bound

sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

name: breast
trans: n. 乳房，胸部；胸怀；心情

sentences.english: These bras are specially designed for women with large breasts.
sentences.chinese: 这些胸罩专为乳房丰满的女性设计。

sentences.english: breast milk
sentences.chinese: 母乳

sentences.english: breast cancer
sentences.chinese: 乳腺癌

sentences.english: Dick cradled her photograph against his breast.
sentences.chinese: 迪克把她的照片轻轻拥在胸前。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two round raised parts on a woman’s chest that produce milk when she has a baby

name: brick
trans: n. 砖，砖块；砖形物；心肠好的人

sentences.english: a brick wall
sentences.chinese: 砖墙

sentences.english: a house made of brick
sentences.chinese: 砖房

sentences.english: Protesters attacked the police with stones and bricks.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者用石头和砖块袭击警察。

detailed_translations.english: a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc

name: brief
trans: n. 摘要，简报；概要，诉书

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

name: briefly
trans: adv. 短暂地；简略地；暂时地

sentences.english: We stopped off briefly in London.
sentences.chinese: 我们在伦敦短暂停留。

detailed_translations.english: for a short time

name: broad
trans: n. 宽阔部分

sentences.english: We went along a broad passage.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在一条宽阔的走廊上。

sentences.english: He was six feet tall, with broad shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，肩膀宽阔。

detailed_translations.english: a road, river, or part of someone’s body etc that is broad is wide

name: broadcast
trans: n. 广播；播音；广播节目

sentences.english: The interview was broadcast live across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 这次采访向整个欧洲进行了现场直播。

detailed_translations.chinese: 播送，播放；（无线电或电视）广播；播撒（种子）
detailed_translations.english: to send out radio or television programmes
a programme on the radio or on television

name: broadcaster
trans: n. 广播公司；广播员；播送设备；撒播物

sentences.english: a well-known broadcaster
sentences.chinese: 一位著名的播音员

detailed_translations.english: someone who speaks on radio or television programmes

name: broadly
trans: adv. 明显地；宽广地；概括地；露骨地；粗鄙地

sentences.english: The president broadly got what he wanted out of his meeting.
sentences.chinese: 总统大体上得到了他想从会议中得到的东西。

name: budget
trans: n. 预算，预算费

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: bug
trans: n. 臭虫，小虫；故障；窃听器

sentences.english: There’s a nasty bug going round (=  that a lot of people have caught  ) .
sentences.chinese: 现在流行着一种很烦人的传染病。

sentences.english: a 24-hour flu bug
sentences.chinese: 一天即愈的流感

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫子；小病；故障，缺陷；窃听器
detailed_translations.english: an illness that people catch very easily from each other but is not very serious

detailed_translations.chinese: 烦扰， 纠缠； 在…装窃听器
detailed_translations.english: to put a  bug (=  small piece of electronic equipment  )  somewhere secretly in order to listen to conversations

name: bullet
trans: n. 子弹；只选某党全部候选人的投票；豆子

sentences.english: He was killed by a single bullet.
sentences.chinese: 他被一枪打死。

sentences.english: a bullet wound in the shoulder
sentences.chinese: 肩上的枪伤

sentences.english: Several bullet holes could be seen beside a window.
sentences.chinese: 窗户边可以看到几个弹孔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 子弹；只选某党全部候选人的投票；豆子
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of metal that you fire from a gun

name: bunch
trans: n. 群；串；突出物

sentences.english: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 她把布揉成一团扔了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束
detailed_translations.english: to pull material together tightly in folds
a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to hold or tie things together in a bunch

name: burn
trans: n. 灼伤，烧伤；烙印

sentences.english: I burnt all his old letters.
sentences.chinese: 我把他以前的信全烧了。

sentences.english: Cars were burned and shops were looted during the rioting.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱期间，汽车被焚，商店遭抢劫。

sentences.english: The Grand Hotel had burnt to the ground .
sentences.chinese: 格兰德大酒店被大火夷为平地。

sentences.english: Make sure the iron isn’t too hot or you’ll burn the cloth.
sentences.chinese: 注意熨斗温度不能过高，免得烫坏布料。

sentences.english: He dropped his cigarette and burnt a hole in the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 他的香烟掉下来，把地毯烫了一个洞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒
detailed_translations.english: to destroy or damage something with fire
an injury caused by fire, heat, the light of the sun, or acid

name: bush
trans: n. 灌木；矮树丛

sentences.english: a rose bush
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰丛

sentences.english: The child was hiding in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子躲在灌木丛里。

detailed_translations.english: a plant with many thin branches growing up from the ground

detailed_translations.chinese: 以灌木装饰；使…精疲力竭
如灌木般长得低矮的；粗野的

name: but
trans: conj. 但是；而是；然而

sentences.english: It’s an old car, but it’s very reliable.
sentences.chinese: 这是一辆旧车，但是性能非常可靠。

sentences.english: They rushed to the hospital, but they were too late.
sentences.chinese: 他们急忙赶到医院，但是已经太迟了。

sentences.english: We’ve invited the boss, but she may decide not to come.
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请过老板，但她有可能决定不来。

sentences.english: an expensive but extremely useful book
sentences.chinese: 价钱很贵却是非常有用的一本书

sentences.english: ‘Has he got any experience?’ ‘No, but he’s keen to learn.’
sentences.chinese: “他有经验吗？”“没有，但他非常好学。”

detailed_translations.english: used to connect two statements or phrases when the second one adds something different or seems surprising after the first one

name: cabin
trans: n. 小屋；客舱；船舱

sentences.english: a log cabin
sentences.chinese: 原木小屋

sentences.english: 英文例句He showed her to a small cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他把她带到一间小房舱。

sentences.english: He sat quietly in the first class cabin of the flight looking tired.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地坐在班机的头等舱内，看上去有些疲惫。

detailed_translations.english: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

name: cable
trans: n. 缆绳；电缆；海底电报

sentences.english: The miners rode a conveyance attached to a cable made of braided steel wire.
sentences.chinese: 矿工们乘坐连着钢索的缆车。

sentences.english: cables and switches for computers
sentences.chinese: 电脑的缆线和开关

sentences.english: She sent a cable to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她给母亲发了封电报。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong metal rope used on ships, to support bridges etc

name: calculate
trans: vt. 计算；预测；认为；打算

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: canal
trans: n. 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠

sentences.english: We walked along by the side of the canal.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着运河边往前走。

sentences.english: the Panama Canal
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河

detailed_translations.chinese: 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠
detailed_translations.english: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

name: cancel
trans: vi. 取消，撤销

sentences.english: Our flight was cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班取消了。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.english: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.chinese: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

name: cancer
trans: [天] 巨蟹座

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

name: candle
trans: n. 蜡烛；烛光；烛形物

sentences.english: The candle flickered in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 烛光在风中闪烁不定。

sentences.english: The candle flickered and then went out.
sentences.chinese: 一开始蜡烛摇曳不定， 然后就灭了。

sentences.english: When the candle was only half an inch high it flickered out and the room became dark.
sentences.chinese: 蜡烛只有半英寸长时，烛光忽闪忽闪地熄灭了，于是房间一片漆黑。

detailed_translations.english: a stick of  wax  with a string through the middle, which you burn to give light

name: capable
trans: adj. 能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: capacity
trans: n. 能力；容量；资格，地位；生产力

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: capture
trans: n. 捕获；战利品，俘虏

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: carbon
trans: n. [化学] 碳；碳棒；复写纸

sentences.english: I dread to think what the carbon footprint must be like of moving that coal but we have no choice.
sentences.chinese: 我都不敢想象为了运这些煤产生了多少碳足迹，但我们没有选择。

sentences.english: By removing whales, sharks and large fish, we ve reduced the amount of carbon stored in these populations.
sentences.chinese: 由于猎杀鲸鱼，鲨鱼和大型鱼类，我们也就减少了碳在这些物种群的储存量。

sentences.english: Across the world, forests and the soil beneath them absorb about a quarter of all carbon emissions.
sentences.chinese: 纵观全球，森林与它们脚下的土壤能吸收大约碳排放总量的四分之一。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that exists in a pure form as diamonds,  graphite  etc, or in an impure form as coal, petrol etc. It is a chemical  element  : symbol C

name: cast
trans: n. 投掷，抛；铸件，[古生] 铸型；演员阵容；脱落物

sentences.english: the shade cast by low-hanging branches
sentences.chinese: 低垂的树枝投下的阴影

detailed_translations.english: to make light or a shadow appear somewhere

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员表， 全体演员； 石膏绷带； 铸型， 铸件； 投， 抛
detailed_translations.english: all the people who perform in a play, film etc

name: casual
trans: n. 便装；临时工人；待命士兵

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

name: catch
trans: n. 捕捉；捕获物；窗钩

sentences.english: Did you catch any fish?
sentences.chinese: 你捕到鱼了吗？

sentences.english: Early settlers caught rabbits and squirrels and even rats in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 早期移民为了生存而捕食野兔、松鼠，甚至老鼠。

sentences.english: I caught the 7.15 train to London.
sentences.chinese: 我赶上了7点15分的火车去伦敦。

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn't quite catch what you said.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我没听清楚你的话。

detailed_translations.english: to trap an animal or fish by using a trap, net, or hook, or by hunting it

name: cave
trans: n. 洞穴，窑洞

sentences.english: the entrance to a cave
sentences.chinese: 洞穴的入口

detailed_translations.chinese: 使凹陷，使塌落；在…挖洞穴
detailed_translations.english: to hollow out
a large natural hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or under the ground

name: cell
trans: n. 细胞；电池；蜂房的巢室；单人小室

sentences.english: cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 癌细胞

sentences.english: Embryos grow by cell division (= the splitting of cells ) .
sentences.chinese: 胚胎通过细胞分裂而成长。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently

name: certainty
trans: n. 必然；确实；确实的事情

sentences.english: the certainty of being caught
sentences.chinese: 被抓的必然

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something is certain to happen

name: certificate
trans: n. 证书；执照，文凭

sentences.english: birth/death/marriage certificate (=giving details of someone’s birth, death, or marriage)
sentences.chinese: 出生/死亡/结婚证书

sentences.english: a degree certificate
sentences.chinese: 学位证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 证书，证件，执照；（毕业）文凭，合格证书
detailed_translations.english: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

name: chain
trans: n. 链；束缚；枷锁

sentences.english: ...a large supermarket chain.
sentences.chinese: …一家大型连锁超市。

detailed_translations.english: a number of shops, hotels, cinemas etc owned or managed by the same company or person

name: chair
trans: n. 椅子；讲座；（会议的）主席位；大学教授的职位

sentences.english: a kitchen chair
sentences.chinese: 厨房椅

sentences.english: They bought a new table and chairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了一套新的桌椅。

sentences.english: One of the chair legs was broken.
sentences.chinese: 椅子有一条腿断了。

sentences.english: Address your questions to the chair, please.
sentences.chinese: 请向主席提出你的问题。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, which has a back, a seat, and four legs

name: chairman
trans: n. 主席，会长；董事长

sentences.english: deputy/vice chairman Barrett serves as vice chairman.
sentences.chinese: 巴雷特担任副主席一职。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a man, who is in charge of a meeting or directs the work of a committee or an organization

name: challenge
trans: n. 挑战；怀疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: challenging
trans: v. 要求；质疑；反对；向…挑战；盘问（challenge的ing形式）

sentences.english: Teaching young children is a challenging and rewarding job.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿教育是一项具有挑战性和有意义的工作。

sentences.english: a challenging problem
sentences.chinese: 具有挑战性的难题

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战的；引起挑战性兴趣的
detailed_translations.english: difficult in an interesting or enjoyable way

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求；质疑；反对；向…挑战；盘问（challenge的ing形式）

name: championship
trans: n. 锦标赛；冠军称号；冠军的地位

sentences.english: the women’s figure skating championships
sentences.chinese: 女子花样滑冰锦标赛

sentences.english: Greece won the European Championship.
sentences.chinese: 希腊队赢得了欧洲锦标赛的冠军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锦标赛；冠军称号；冠军的地位
detailed_translations.english: a competition to find which player, team etc is the best in a particular sport

name: characteristic
trans: n. 特征；特性；特色

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

name: charming
trans: adj. 迷人的；可爱的

sentences.english: a charming little Italian restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家有吸引力的意大利小餐厅

sentences.english: Harry can be very charming.
sentences.chinese: 哈里有时候很讨人喜欢。

detailed_translations.english: very pleasing or attractive

name: chart
trans: n. 图表；海图；图纸；排行榜

sentences.english: a chart showing last year’s sales
sentences.chinese: 显示去年销售情况的一份图表

sentences.english: a weather chart
sentences.chinese: 天气图

sentences.english: the theatre’s seating chart
sentences.chinese: 剧场的座位图

detailed_translations.english: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

detailed_translations.chinese: 用图表表示， 在图上表示
detailed_translations.english: if a record charts, it enters the weekly list of the most popular records

name: chase
trans: n. 追逐；追赶；追击

sentences.english: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗看到他在跑就追他。

sentences.english: kids chasing around the house
sentences.chinese: 在屋里追逐嬉戏的孩子们

detailed_translations.chinese: 追逐， 追赶， 追求
detailed_translations.english: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

name: cheek
trans: n. 面颊，脸颊；臀部

sentences.english: Lucy stretched up to kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 露西伸长了脖子去亲吻他的脸颊。

sentences.english: Billy had rosy cheeks and blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 比利脸颊红润，长着一双蓝眼睛。

sentences.english: her tear-stained cheeks
sentences.chinese: 她泪痕斑斑的脸颊

sentences.english: Julie’s cheeks flushed with pleasure at the compliment.
sentences.chinese: 听了这赞美的话，朱莉开心得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: the soft round part of your face below each of your eyes

detailed_translations.chinese: 无礼地向…讲话，对…大胆无礼
detailed_translations.english: to speak rudely or with disrespect to someone, especially to someone older such as your teacher or parents

name: cheer
trans: n. 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事

sentences.english: Everybody cheered when the firemen arrived.
sentences.chinese: 消防员到达时，大家都欢呼起来。

sentences.english: The audience was shouting and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 观众在呐喊欢呼。

sentences.english: The spectators cheered him wildly.
sentences.chinese: 观众拼命为他加油。

detailed_translations.english: to shout as a way of showing happiness, praise, approval, or support of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事
detailed_translations.english: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

name: chief
trans: n. 首领；酋长；主要部分

sentences.english: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
sentences.chinese: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.english: Safety is our chief concern .
sentences.chinese: 安全问题是我们的头等大事。

sentences.english: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是因为人们更长寿了。

sentences.english: his chief rival for the job
sentences.chinese: 和他竞争这份工作的主要对手

sentences.english: the prosecution’s chief witness
sentences.chinese: 控方的主要证人

sentences.english: She had many reasons for taking the money, but chief among them was revenge.
sentences.chinese: 她拿这笔钱的原因有很多，但最主要的是为了报复。

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 首领， 长官； 酋长， 族长
detailed_translations.english: the ruler of a tribe

name: choir
trans: n. 唱诗班；合唱队；舞蹈队

sentences.english: The boy sings bass in the choir.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩在合唱团里唱男低音。

sentences.english: You joined the choir, but you don't even like singing. What is your design anyway?
sentences.chinese: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

sentences.english: In a window across the street, a boy plays the flute, echoing the choir's songs.
sentences.chinese: 在街对面的一扇窗户里，一位少年吹着长笛，附和着唱诗班的歌声。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to

name: chop
trans: n. 砍；排骨；商标；削球

sentences.english: He went outside to chop some more wood for the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他出去再砍些木材来生火。

sentences.english: Can you chop up some carrots for me?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我切一些胡萝卜吗？

sentences.english: Add two finely chopped onions and a clove of garlic.
sentences.chinese: 加上两个切碎的洋葱和一瓣大蒜。

detailed_translations.english: to cut something into smaller pieces
to cut something into smaller pieces

name: circuit
trans: n. [电子] 电路，回路；巡回；一圈；环道

sentences.english: We did a circuit of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 我们绕着老城走了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a path that forms a circle around an area, or a journey along this path

name: circumstance
trans: n. 环境，情况；事件；境遇

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；传讯；想起；表彰

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: citizen
trans: n. 公民；市民；老百姓

sentences.english: We need our schools to teach students to be good citizens.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.english: The mayor urged citizens to begin preparing for a major storm.
sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town, country, or state

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: clarify
trans: vt. 澄清；阐明

sentences.english: Reporters asked him to clarify his position (= say exactly what his beliefs are ) on welfare reform.
sentences.chinese: 记者们要求他阐明他在福利改革问题上的立场。

detailed_translations.english: to make something clearer or easier to understand

name: classic
trans: n. 名著；经典著作；大艺术家

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

name: classify
trans: vt. 分类；分等

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: clerk
trans: n. 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

name: cliff
trans: n. 悬崖；绝壁

sentences.english: The car rolled over the edge of a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 汽车翻下了悬崖边。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

name: clinic
trans: n. 临床；诊所

sentences.english: an appointment at an outpatient clinic
sentences.chinese: 门诊预约

detailed_translations.english: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital

name: close
trans: n. 结束

sentences.english: Would you mind if I closed the window?
sentences.chinese: 我把窗户关上你不介意吧？

sentences.english: She closed the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 她拉上了窗帘。

sentences.english: Let me do the car door – it won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 我来修一下车门，它关不紧。

sentences.english: Beth closed her eyes and tried to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝合上眼睛想睡觉。

sentences.english: She heard the door close behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她听见门在她身后关上了。

sentences.english: I will now close the meeting by asking you to join me in a final toast.
sentences.chinese: 现在我要请大家最后干一杯来结束这次会议。

detailed_translations.english: to shut something in order to cover an opening, or to become shut in this way

name: closely
trans: adv. 紧密地；接近地；严密地；亲近地

sentences.english: The successful applicant will be working closely with our international staff.
sentences.chinese: 被录用者将与我们的国际员工紧密合作。

sentences.english: lightning, followed closely by thunder
sentences.chinese: 闪电，紧跟着是雷鸣

sentences.english: We were so closely packed in the elevator I could hardly move.
sentences.chinese: 电梯里人挨着人，我几乎动弹不得。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: coincidence
trans: n. 巧合；一致；同时发生

sentences.english: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’
sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合
detailed_translations.english: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual

name: collapse
trans: n. 倒塌；失败；衰竭

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: collector
trans: n. 收藏家；[电子] 集电极；收税员；征收者

sentences.english: a stamp collector
sentences.chinese: 集邮者

sentences.english: The painting was bought by a private collector.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画被一个私人收藏家买走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收藏家；[电子] 集电极；收税员；征收者
detailed_translations.english: someone who collects things that are interesting or attractive

name: colony
trans: n. 殖民地；移民队；种群；动物栖息地

sentences.english: Algeria was formerly a French colony.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔及利亚以前是法国的殖民地。

detailed_translations.english: a country or area that is under the political control of a more powerful country, usually one that is far away

name: colourful
trans: adj. 鲜艳的；生动的；色彩丰富的；富有趣味的

sentences.english: a colourful display of flowers
sentences.chinese: 一片五彩缤纷的鲜花

sentences.english: colorful costumes
sentences.chinese: 色彩鲜艳的服装

detailed_translations.chinese: 鲜艳的；生动的；色彩丰富的；富有趣味的
detailed_translations.english: having bright colours or a lot of different colours

name: combination
trans: n. 结合；组合；联合；[化学] 化合

sentences.english: a combination nightclub and café
sentences.chinese: 夜总会兼咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

name: comfort
trans: n. 安慰；舒适；安慰者

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

name: comic
trans: n. 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物

sentences.english: a comic novel
sentences.chinese: 滑稽小说

detailed_translations.english: amusing you and making you want to laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
detailed_translations.english: a magazine for children that tells a story using comic strips

name: command
trans: n. 指挥，控制；命令；司令部

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: commander
trans: n. 指挥官；司令官

sentences.english: the American Commander, General Otis
sentences.chinese: 美军指挥官奥蒂斯将军

sentences.english: our platoon commander
sentences.chinese: 我们的排长

detailed_translations.english: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity

name: commission
trans: n. 委员会；佣金；犯；委任；委任状

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: commitment
trans: n. 承诺，保证；委托；承担义务；献身

sentences.english: Are you ready to make a long-term commitment ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否准备好作出长久的承诺？

detailed_translations.english: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: commonly
trans: adv. 一般地；通常地；普通地

sentences.english: Sodium chloride is more commonly known as salt.
sentences.chinese: 氯化钠通常都称为盐。

sentences.english: a commonly used industrial chemical
sentences.chinese: 一种常用的工业化学品

detailed_translations.english: usually or by most people

name: comparative
trans: n. 比较级；对手

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: completion
trans: n. 完成，结束；实现

sentences.english: The house is nearing completion (= almost finished ) .
sentences.chinese: 房子即将完工。

sentences.english: The project has a completion date of December 22nd.
sentences.chinese: 该项目的完成日期是12月22日。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being finished

name: complex
trans: n. 复合体；综合设施

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
