detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: emotionally
trans: adv. 感情上；情绪上；令人激动地；情绪冲动地

name: emphasis
trans: n. 重点；强调；加强语气

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: emphasize
trans: vt. 强调，着重

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: empire
trans: n. 帝国；帝王统治，君权

sentences.english: the Roman empire
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国

detailed_translations.english: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

name: enable
trans: vt. 使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: encounter
trans: n. 遭遇，偶然碰见

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: engage
trans: vi. 从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增加

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: enjoyable
trans: adj. 快乐的；有乐趣的；令人愉快的

sentences.english: Games can make learning more enjoyable.
sentences.chinese: 游戏可以寓教于乐。

sentences.english: an enjoyable experience
sentences.chinese: 令人愉快的经历

detailed_translations.chinese: 快乐的；有乐趣的；令人愉快的
detailed_translations.english: something enjoyable gives you pleasure

name: enquiry
trans: n. [计] 询问，[贸易] 询盘

sentences.english: We are pleased to receive your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴收到您的询问函。

sentences.english: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
sentences.chinese: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sentences.english: When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。

name: ensure
trans: vt. 保证，确保；使安全

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: entertaining
trans: v. 款待（entertain的ing形式）

sentences.english: Children’s TV nowadays is much more entertaining.
sentences.chinese: 如今的儿童电视节目要比过去有趣多了。

sentences.english: an entertaining evening
sentences.chinese: 令人愉快的夜晚

detailed_translations.english: amusing and interesting

name: enthusiasm
trans: n. 热心，热忱，热情

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: enthusiastic
trans: adj. 热情的；热心的；狂热的

sentences.english: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
sentences.chinese: 改革的热心支持者

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

name: entire
trans: adj. 全部的，整个的；全体的

sentences.english: It was the worst day in my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。

sentences.english: The entire staff agreed.
sentences.chinese: 全体员工都同意了。

sentences.english: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
sentences.chinese: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

name: entirely
trans: adv. 完全地，彻底地

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家；承包人；主办者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: envelope
trans: n. 信封，封皮；包膜；[天] 包层；包迹

sentences.english: envelopes and stamps
sentences.chinese: 信封和邮票

sentences.english: She tore open the envelope and frantically read the letter.
sentences.chinese: 她撕开信封慌忙看信。

sentences.english: He got a job stuffing envelopes (= filling them with letters ) at the campaign headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他找了一份在竞选总部装信封的工作。

detailed_translations.english: a thin paper cover in which you put and send a letter

name: equal
trans: n. 对手；匹敌；同辈；相等的事物

sentences.english: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

sentences.english: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。

sentences.english: He treats all his staff as equals.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Two plus two equals four.
sentences.chinese: 二加二等于四。

detailed_translations.english: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

name: equip
trans: vt. 装备，配备

sentences.english: They try to equip their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽量给他们的车辆配备各种小装置以应付任何可能的突发状况。

detailed_translations.english: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

name: equivalent
trans: n. 等价物，相等物

sentences.english: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
sentences.chinese: 我没有美金，但给了他等值的英镑。

detailed_translations.english: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else

name: era
trans: n. 时代；年代；纪元

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: erupt
trans: vi. 爆发；喷出；发疹；长牙

sentences.english: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪，暴乱随之发生。

sentences.english: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
sentences.chinese: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

sentences.english: The volcano erupted in 1980, devastating a large area of Washington state.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山1980年喷发，摧毁了华盛顿州的大片地区。

detailed_translations.english: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

name: essentially
trans: adv. 本质上；本来

sentences.english: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.english: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

detailed_translations.english: used when stating the most basic facts about something

name: establish
trans: vi. 植物定植

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: estate
trans: n. 房地产；财产；身份

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: estimate
trans: n. 估计，估价；判断，看法

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: ethic
trans: n. 伦理；道德规范

sentences.english: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes

name: ethical
trans: n. 处方药

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

name: ethnic
trans: adj. 种族的；人种的

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

name: evaluate
trans: vt. 评价；估价；求…的值

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: evaluation
trans: n. 评价；[审计] 评估；估价；求值

sentences.english: We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.
sentences.chinese: 我们要对新系统进行合理的评估。

sentences.english: They took some samples of products for evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 他们抽取了一些产品样本以作评估。

detailed_translations.english: a judgment about how good, useful, or successful something is

name: even
trans: adj. [数] 偶数的；平坦的；相等的

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

name: evident
trans: adj. 明显的；明白的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: evil
trans: n. 罪恶，邪恶；不幸

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful
someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people

name: evolution
trans: n. 演变；进化论；进展

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: evolve
trans: vi. 发展，进展；进化；逐步形成

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: examination
trans: n. 考试；检查；查问

sentences.english: The examination results will be announced in September.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩将于9月公布。

sentences.english: He’s already taken the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他已经参加了入学考试。

sentences.english: The proposals are still under examination.
sentences.chinese: 那些提案还在审查之中。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

name: exceed
trans: vt. 超过；胜过

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: exception
trans: n. 例外；异议

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: exclude
trans: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: excuse
trans: n. 借口；理由

sentences.english: I’ll excuse you this time, but don’t be late again.
sentences.chinese: 这次我原谅你，但别再迟到了。

sentences.english: Please excuse my bad handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅，我的字写得不好。

sentences.english: Can I be excused from swimming today? I have a cold.
sentences.chinese: 我今天能不游泳吗？我感冒了。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for doing something that is not seriously wrong, such as being rude or careless
a reason that you invent to explain an action and to hide your real intentions

name: executive
trans: n. 总经理；执行委员会；执行者；经理主管人员

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: exhibit
trans: n. 展览品；证据；展示会

sentences.english: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

detailed_translations.english: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it

name: existence
trans: n. 存在，实在；生存，生活；存在物，实在物

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: exit
trans: n. 出口，通道；退场

sentences.english: We made for the nearest exit.
sentences.chinese: 我们走向最近的出口。

sentences.english: an exit door
sentences.chinese: 出口门

sentences.english: Two men were blocking her exit.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人挡住了她出去的路。

detailed_translations.english: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc
to leave a place

name: exotic
trans: adj. 异国的；外来的；异国情调的

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: expansion
trans: n. 膨胀；阐述；扩张物

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: expectation
trans: n. 期待；预期；指望

sentences.english: Having raised expectations (= made people more hopeful ), he went on to help only a few people.
sentences.chinese: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.english: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.english: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

detailed_translations.english: what you think or hope will happen

name: expense
trans: n. 损失，代价；消费；开支

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: expertise
trans: n. 专门知识；专门技术；专家的意见

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: exploit
trans: n. 勋绩；功绩

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: exploration
trans: n. 探测；探究；踏勘

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露；曝光；揭露；陈列

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: extend
trans: vt. 延伸；扩大；推广；伸出；给予；使竭尽全力；对…估价

sentences.english: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

detailed_translations.english: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer

name: extension
trans: n. 延长；延期；扩大；伸展；电话分机

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: extensive
trans: adj. 广泛的；大量的；广阔的

sentences.english: The house stands in extensive grounds.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
sentences.chinese: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

sentences.english: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

name: extensively
trans: adv. 广阔地；广大地

sentences.english: The new rocket was extensively tested and debugged by the army.
sentences.chinese: 这种新式火箭由军方进行了广泛的测试和调试。

sentences.english: Dr Alloway, from the University of Stirling in Scotland, has extensively studied working memory and believes it to be far more important to success and happiness than IQ.
sentences.chinese: 来自苏格兰的斯特灵大学阿洛韦博士，已经广泛的研究“工作记忆”，并认为它是比智商更为重要对于成功和幸福来说。

name: extent
trans: n. 程度；范围；长度

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

name: external
trans: n. 外部；外观；外面

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: extract
trans: n. 汁；摘录；榨出物；选粹

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: extraordinary
trans: adj. 非凡的；特别的；离奇的；临时的；特派的

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: extreme
trans: n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: fabric
trans: n. 织物；布；组织；构造；建筑物

sentences.english: our new range of fabrics and wallpapers
sentences.chinese: 我们新的织物和墙纸系列

sentences.english: The country’s social fabric is disintegrating.
sentences.chinese: 该国的社会结构正在瓦解。

detailed_translations.english: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

name: fabulous
trans: adj. 难以置信的；传说的，寓言中的；极好的

sentences.english: the Duke’s fabulous wealth
sentences.chinese: 那位公爵的巨额财富

sentences.english: You look fabulous!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去美极了！

sentences.english: a fabulous meal
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的一餐

sentences.english: The room has fabulous views across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 那个房间可以看到美丽的湖景。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or size

name: facility
trans: n. 设施；设备；容易；灵巧

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: failed
trans: v. 失败，不成功（fail的过去式和过去分词）

name: failure
trans: n. 失败；故障；失败者；破产

sentences.english: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

sentences.english: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

name: faith
trans: n. 信仰；信念；信任；忠实

sentences.english: People have lost faith in the government.
sentences.chinese: 人们已失去了对政府的信心。

sentences.english: deep religious faith
sentences.chinese: 坚定的宗教信仰

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

name: fake
trans: n. 假货；骗子；假动作

sentences.english: fake fur
sentences.chinese: 人造毛皮

sentences.english: a fake ID card
sentences.chinese: 假身份证

sentences.english: a fake 20 dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张20美元的伪钞

detailed_translations.english: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造， 捏造； 伪装
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem real in order to deceive people

name: fame
trans: n. 名声，名望；传闻，传说

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

name: fantasy
trans: n. 幻想；白日梦；幻觉

sentences.english: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: fare
trans: n. 票价；费用；旅客；食物

sentences.english: It is unlikely that the marine industry will fare any better in September.
sentences.chinese: 海运业不大可能在9月份有所好转。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity
the price you pay to travel somewhere by bus, train, plane etc

name: fault
trans: n. 故障；[地质] 断层；错误；缺点；毛病；（网球等）发球失误

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

name: favour
trans: n. 偏爱；赞同；善行

sentences.english: Could you do me a favour and tell Kelly I can’t make it?
sentences.chinese: 你帮个忙告诉凯莉说我来不了好吗？

sentences.english: He hired John as a favour to his father.
sentences.chinese: 他雇约翰是给他父亲一个面子。

sentences.english: Paul, can I ask you a favor ?
sentences.chinese: 保罗，能帮我一下吗？

sentences.english: I owed him a favour so I couldn’t say no.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一个人情，所以无法拒绝。

sentences.english: She helps me out when I have too much to do, and I return the favour when I can.
sentences.chinese: 我忙的时候她来帮忙，我能帮她的时候就还她人情。

sentences.english: Do yourself a favour and make sure you get some time to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 对自己好些，一定要留点时间给自己。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them

detailed_translations.chinese: 赞同； 喜爱， 偏爱； 有利于
detailed_translations.english: to provide suitable conditions for something to happen

name: feather
trans: n. 羽毛

sentences.english: an ostrich feather
sentences.chinese: 一根鸵鸟羽毛

detailed_translations.english: one of the light soft things that cover a bird’s body

name: federal
trans: adv. 联邦政府地

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: fee
trans: n. 费用；酬金；小费

sentences.english: You can use the gym and pool for a fee of £35 a month.
sentences.chinese: 月付35英镑，即可使用健身房和游泳池。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work

name: feed
trans: n. 饲料；饲养；（动物或婴儿的）一餐

sentences.english: Have you fed the cat?
sentences.chinese: 你喂猫了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to give food to a person or animal

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈；成果，资料；回复

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: feel
trans: n. 感觉；触摸

sentences.english: I am feeling very depressed.
sentences.chinese: 我感到很沮丧。

sentences.english: Suddenly I felt a sharp pain in my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 我突然感到肩部一阵剧痛。

sentences.english: I felt as if all my strength had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得好象自己的力气已经全没了。

sentences.english: I felt like I was being kicked in the teeth every day.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉我好像每天都在经受挫折。

detailed_translations.english: If you feel a particular emotion or physical sensation, you experience it
to give you a particular physical feeling, especially when you touch or hold something

name: fellow
trans: n. 家伙；朋友；同事；会员

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

name: fever
trans: n. 发烧，发热；狂热

sentences.english: Andy has a fever and won’t be coming into work today.
sentences.chinese: 安迪发烧了，今天不来上班。

sentences.english: I woke up this morning with a fever and an upset stomach.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上醒来时我发烧了，胃也不舒服。

sentences.english: She’s running a fever (= has a fever ) .
sentences.chinese: 她在发烧。

detailed_translations.english: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature

detailed_translations.chinese: 使发烧；使狂热；使患热病

name: figure
trans: n. 数字；人物；图形；价格；（人的）体形；画像

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算； 认为， 猜想
detailed_translations.english: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

name: file
trans: n. 文件；档案；文件夹；锉刀

sentences.english: We will keep your details on file (= store them for later use ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

sentences.english: The contracts are filed alphabetically.
sentences.chinese: 这些合同是按字母顺序归档的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject
to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily

name: finance
trans: n. 财政，财政学；金融

sentences.english: leasing and other forms of business finance
sentences.chinese: 租赁及其他商业金融形式

sentences.english: Russia’s finance minister
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯财政部长

sentences.english: the world of high finance
sentences.chinese: 高级金融界

detailed_translations.chinese: 财政，金融；财源，财务情况
detailed_translations.english: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something

name: finding
trans: n. 发现；裁决；发现物

sentences.english: Surveys conducted in other countries reported similar findings.
sentences.chinese: 在其他国家进行的调查也报告说有类似的结果。

detailed_translations.english: the information that someone has discovered as a result of their study, work etc

name: firefighter
trans: n. 消防队员

sentences.english: When every molecule in your body tells you to run away from the burning building, as a firefighter you have to resist the urge, override it and plunge in.
sentences.chinese: 当你身体内每个细胞都告诉逃离失火的建筑物时，作为一名消防员，你必须克制这种冲动，超越它，投入火场进行战斗。

sentences.english: He mows lawns and gardens for half a dozen clients in Grafton, some of them family friends. And he is an active volunteer firefighter.
sentences.chinese: 他为格拉夫顿六户人家修剪草坪和花园，他们中一些是父母的朋友，此外他还是个积极的义务消防员。

sentences.english: Locally and from the state standpoint, we had some firefighter jobs that were in jeopardy, up in the hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 站在州政府的立场，我们有一些消防员在危险岗位工作，最多时有数百人。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to stop fires burning

name: firework
trans: n. 烟火；激烈情绪

sentences.english: a New Year’s Eve fireworks display
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜的烟火表演

sentences.english: Jeff and David were in the back yard setting off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 杰夫和戴维在后院放烟花。

detailed_translations.english: a small container filled with powder that burns or explodes to produce coloured lights and noise in the sky

name: firm
trans: n. 公司；商号

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

name: firmly
trans: adv. 坚定地，坚决地；坚固地，稳固地

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚定地，坚决地；坚固地，稳固地

name: fix
trans: n. 困境；方位；贿赂

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: flame
trans: n. 火焰；热情；光辉

sentences.english: Flames poured out of the windows of the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰从大楼窗口冒出来。

sentences.english: They rushed past us with buckets of water and tried to douse the flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们提着一桶桶水跑过我们身边去灭火。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们围坐在篝火旁，看着跳动的火焰。

sentences.english: Flames quickly engulfed the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰很快吞噬了大楼。

sentences.english: a candle flame
sentences.chinese: 烛焰

detailed_translations.english: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire
to burn brightly

name: flash
trans: n. 闪光，闪现；一瞬间

sentences.english: Two flashes mean danger.
sentences.chinese: 两次闪光表示危险。

sentences.english: Lightning flashed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 头顶上电光闪闪。

detailed_translations.english: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining
to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way

name: flavour
trans: n. 香味；滋味

sentences.english: Which flavour do you want - chocolate or vanilla?
sentences.chinese: 你要哪种味道的，巧克力还是香草？

detailed_translations.english: the particular taste of a food or drink

name: flexible
trans: adj. 灵活的；柔韧的；易弯曲的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: float
trans: n. 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

name: fold
trans: n. 折痕；信徒；羊栏

sentences.english: Fold the paper along the dotted line.
sentences.chinese: 沿虚线将纸折起来。

sentences.english: It’ll fit in if you fold it in half .
sentences.chinese: 对折的话就能放下了。

detailed_translations.english: to bend a piece of paper, cloth etc by laying or pressing one part over another
a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

name: folding
trans: adj. 可折叠的

name: following
trans: n. 下列事物；一批追随者

sentences.english: He was sick in the evening, but the following day he was better.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上他生病了，但第二天就好一些了。

sentences.english: Write down the following information: name of product, type, date purchased and price.
sentences.chinese: 写下以下信息：产品名称、型号、购买日期和价格。

detailed_translations.english: the next afternoon, month etc

name: fond
trans: adj. 喜欢的；温柔的；宠爱的

sentences.english: I am very fond of Michael.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢迈克尔。

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

name: fool
trans: n. 傻瓜；愚人；受骗者

sentences.english: What a fool she had been to think that he would stay.
sentences.chinese: 她竟然那么傻，以为他会留下来。

sentences.english: Like a fool, I accepted straight away.
sentences.chinese: 我像个傻子，立刻就接受了。

sentences.english: You silly old fool !
sentences.chinese: 你这个大傻瓜！

sentences.english: Even art experts were fooled.
sentences.chinese: 连艺术品专家也被骗了。

detailed_translations.english: a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid
to trick someone into believing something that is not true

name: forbid
trans: vt. 禁止；不准；不允许；〈正式〉严禁

sentences.english: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

name: forecast
trans: n. 预测，预报；预想

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

name: forgive
trans: vt. 原谅；免除（债务、义务等）

sentences.english: He didn’t look the sort of man to forgive and forget (= forgive someone and no longer think about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去不是那种不记仇的人。

detailed_translations.english: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong

name: format
trans: n. 格式；版式；开本

sentences.english: The courses were run to a consistent format.
sentences.chinese: 这些课程的编排是有连续性的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计，安排；格式，样式，版式
detailed_translations.english: the way in which something such as a television show or meeting is organized or arranged
to organize the space on a computer  disk  so that information can be stored on it

name: formation
trans: n. 形成；构造；编队

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: former
trans: n. 模型，样板；起形成作用的人

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

name: formerly
trans: adv. 以前；原来

sentences.english: Kiribati, formerly known as the Gilbert Islands
sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯，旧称吉尔伯特群岛

sentences.english: This elegant hotel was formerly a castle.
sentences.chinese: 这家雅致的酒店以前是座城堡。

detailed_translations.english: in earlier times

name: fortunate
trans: adj. 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

name: fortune
trans: n. 财富；命运；运气

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

name: forum
trans: n. 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: forward
trans: n. 前锋

sentences.english: He leaned forward , his elbows resting on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他身体前倾，胳膊肘撑在桌子上。

sentences.english: The crowd surged forwards.

trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人

sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

trans: v. 找到（find的过去分词）

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.

trans: n. 基础；地基；基金会；根据；创立

sentences.chinese: 建筑工人花了三星期的时间打地基。

sentences.english: The earthquake shook the foundations of the house.
sentences.chinese: 地震动摇了那幢房子的地基。

sentences.english: the British Heart Foundation
sentences.chinese: 英国心脏病基金会

detailed_translations.english: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

name: founder
trans: n. 创始人；建立者；翻沙工

sentences.english: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的婚姻在蜜月之后不久便触礁了。

someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc

name: fraction
trans: n. 分数；部分；小部分；稍微

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

trans: n. 碎片；片断或不完整部分

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分

to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

name: framework
trans: n. 框架，骨架；结构，构架

sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

trans: n. 欺骗；骗子；诡计

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["electoral fraud"]}
sentences.chinese: 选举欺诈

sentences.english: She was found guilty of fraud.
sentences.chinese: 她被判犯有诈骗罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺诈， 诈骗； 骗子
detailed_translations.english: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

name: free
trans: adj. 免费的；自由的，不受约束的；[化学] 游离的

sentences.chinese: 他知道只要再过三年他就能自由了。

sentences.chinese: 这一跳他就自由了！

sentences.english: He walked out of the courtroom a free man .
sentences.chinese: 他从法庭走出来，成了自由人。

sentences.english: They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free .
sentences.chinese: 他们呼吁政府释放所有政治犯。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
sentences.chinese: 他被判无罪，当庭释放。

sentences.english: The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物可以在公园里自由奔跑。

sentences.english: I’m free next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 下个周末我有空。

detailed_translations.english: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner

name: freedom
trans: n. 自由，自主；直率

sentences.english: People here like their freedom and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。

sentences.english: the rights and freedoms of citizens
sentences.chinese: 公民的权利与自由

sentences.english: the freedom to vote
sentences.chinese: 选举自由

sentences.english: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
sentences.chinese: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

detailed_translations.english: the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone

name: freely
trans: adv. 自由地；免费地；大量地；慷慨地；直率地

sentences.chinese: 该国首位自由选举产生的总统

sentences.english: EU members are allowed to travel freely between member states.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟成员国国民可以在成员国之间自由旅行。

trans: n. 频率；频繁

sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents

trans: adj. 频繁的；时常发生的；惯常的

sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often

trans: n. 燃料；刺激因素

sentences.english: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
sentences.chinese: 煤是最廉价的燃料之一。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

name: fulfil
trans: vt. 履行；完成；实践；满足

sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，这计划会满足我们社区的需求。

detailed_translations.english: to do or provide what is necessary or needed

trans: adj. 专职的；全日制的；全部时间的

sentences.chinese: …一份全职工作。

detailed_translations.english: for all the hours of a week during which it is usual for people to work, study etc

trans: adv. 充分地；完全地；彻底地

sentences.chinese: 今晚这家餐厅订满了。

sentences.english: Elisa has not fully recovered from the incident.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉莎还没有完全从这个事件中恢复过来。

sentences.english: I fully accept that what he says is true.
sentences.chinese: 我完全同意，他的话属实。

sentences.english: This concept is discussed more fully in Chapter 9.
sentences.chinese: 这一概念在第九章中有更详细的论述。

sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用

trans: n. 基金；资金；存款

sentences.chinese: 设立基金以挽救大教堂。

trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则

sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

trans: adv. 根本地，从根本上；基础地

sentences.chinese: 这份报告的结论从根本上来说就是错误的。

trans: n. 提供资金；用发行长期债券的方法来收回短期债券

sentences.chinese: 他们希望得到政府为这一计划提供的资金。

sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

trans: n. 增加；利润；收获

sentences.chinese: 1957年获得独立后，该国改名为“加纳”。

sentences.chinese: 民主党只需要增20张选票。

trans: n. 群；一伙；一组

trans: n. 性；性别；性交

sentences.chinese: 严禁种族歧视和性别歧视。

sentences.english: There may be gender differences in attitudes to paid work.

sentences.chinese: 不强化性别模式化观念的玩具

sentences.english: a science fiction story dealing with gender issues
sentences.chinese: 以性别问题为题材的科幻故事

trans: n. [遗] 基因，遗传因子

sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

trans: adj. 遗传的；基因的；起源的

sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

name: genius

name: genre
trans: n. 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画

sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画

trans: adj. 真实的，真正的；诚恳的

sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

trans: n. 旋转物；鱼叉；轻便双轮马车；现场演出；临时工作

trans: n. 全球化

sentences.chinese: 世界贸易的日益全球化

detailed_translations.english: the process of making something such as a business operate in a lot of different countries all around the world, or the result of this

name: globe
trans: n. 地球；地球仪；球体

sentences.chinese: 3个巨大的地球仪立在地板上。

sentences.english: We export our goods all over the globe.
sentences.chinese: 我们的商品出口到世界各地。

detailed_translations.english: the world

name: golden
trans: adj. 金色的，黄金般的；珍贵的；金制的

sentences.english: golden hair
sentences.chinese: 金发

sentences.english: golden sand
sentences.chinese: 金色的沙

sentences.english: He wasted a golden opportunity when he missed from the penalty spot.
sentences.chinese: 他罚球没有命中，浪费了一个绝佳的机会。

name: goodness
trans: n. 善良，优秀 ；精华，养分

sentences.english: the desire to see goodness and justice in the world
sentences.chinese: 对善良和正义的向往

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being good

name: gorgeous
trans: adj. 华丽的，灿烂的；极好的

sentences.english: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
sentences.chinese: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”

sentences.english: exotic birds with feathers of gorgeous colours
sentences.chinese: 长着绚丽羽毛的异国的鸟

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.english: The party had been governing for seven months.
sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

sentences.english: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

name: governor

sentences.chinese: 他是20世纪70年代末爱荷华州的州长。

sentences.english: the prison governor
sentences.chinese: 监狱长

detailed_translations.english: the person in charge of governing a state in the US

name: grab
trans: n. 攫取；霸占；夺取之物

sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: grade
trans: n. 年级；等级；成绩；级别；阶段

sentences.english: Pencils are graded according to softness.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

sentences.english: The best grades of tea are expensive.
sentences.chinese: 最上等的茶叶价格很贵。

detailed_translations.english: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is

name: gradually
trans: adv. 逐步地；渐渐地

sentences.english: Jill gradually became aware of an awful smell.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔渐渐地闻到了一股难闻的气味。

sentences.english: Gradually, my ankle got better.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚踝慢慢好了。

detailed_translations.english: slowly, over a long period of time

name: grand
trans: n. 大钢琴；一千美元

sentences.english: a grand country house
sentences.chinese: 豪华的乡间大宅

sentences.english: The party was a grand affair.
sentences.chinese: 这个聚会场面隆重。

sentences.english: New Yorkers build on a grand scale.
sentences.chinese: 纽约人喜欢建高楼大厦。

detailed_translations.english: big and very impressive

name: grant
trans: n. 拨款；[法] 授予物

sentences.english: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
sentences.chinese: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。

sentences.english: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
sentences.chinese: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for

name: graphic
trans: adj. 形象的；图表的；绘画似的

sentences.english: ...fine and graphic arts.
sentences.chinese: …美术与制图艺术。

name: graphics
trans: n. [测] 制图学；制图法；图表算法

sentences.english: In this in-depth motion graphics tutorial you will learn how to use vector shapes for 3D motion graphics.
sentences.chinese: 在这种深入的运动图形教程中，您将学习如何使用矢量图形的3D动态图像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 图形， 图像； 制图法， 制图学

name: greatly
trans: adv. 很，大大地；非常

sentences.english: All offers of help will be greatly appreciated .
sentences.chinese: 如蒙帮助，感激不尽。

sentences.english: The quality of health care varies greatly .
sentences.chinese: 医疗保健服务质量差别很大。

detailed_translations.english: extremely or very much
