sentences.english: What we are seeking, after all, is not simply an agreement to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻求的目标毕竟不只是一项限制温室气体排放的协议。

sentences.english: I think each and every one of us is responsible for the greenhouse gases we emit in our daily actions and choices.
sentences.chinese: 我认为每一个人都是我们每天的行动和选择中排放的温室气体的责任。

sentences.english: But presently it was set in a greenhouse, where the sunlight fell warm upon it, and water was sprinkled over it, and day by day as it waited, a change began to come to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是过了不久，黏土又给人放进了一间温室，这里阳光和煦地照射着它，并且经常给它喷水，这样就在它一天天静静等候的时候，某种变化终于开始到来。

detailed_translations.english: a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

name: grocery
trans: n. 食品杂货店

sentences.english: They run a small grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 他们经营一家小食品杂货店。

detailed_translations.english: food and other goods that are sold by a grocer or a supermarket

name: guarantee
trans: n. 保证；担保；保证人；保证书；抵押品

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: guideline
trans: n. 指导方针

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: handle
trans: n. [建] 把手；柄；手感；口实

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: harbour
trans: n. 海港（等于harbor）；避难所

sentences.english: I think he’s harbouring some sort of grudge against me.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他对我有点怀恨在心。

sentences.english: Sinks and draining boards can harbour germs.
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽和沥水板可能藏有病菌。

sentences.english: Accusations of harbouring suspects were raised against the former Hungarian leadership.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利前领导人被指控窝藏疑犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀着（不好的想法、恐惧或希望）；包含，藏有；窝藏
detailed_translations.english: to keep bad thoughts, fears, or hopes in your mind for a long time

name: harm
trans: n. 伤害；损害

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: harmful
trans: adj. 有害的；能造成损害的

sentences.english: the harmful effects of smoking
sentences.chinese: 吸烟的害处

detailed_translations.english: causing harm

name: headquarters
trans: n. 总部；指挥部；司令部

sentences.english: the headquarters of the United Nations
sentences.chinese: 联合国总部

sentences.english: Headquarters in Dublin has/have agreed.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林总部已经同意了

detailed_translations.english: the main building or offices used by a large company or organization

name: heal
trans: vt. 治愈，痊愈；和解

sentences.english: a preacher who claims that he can heal the sick
sentences.chinese: 自称可以治病的传道士

sentences.english: The rift between the two younger men never healed.
sentences.chinese: 两个较年轻者之间的裂痕从未得以弥合。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone who is ill become healthy again, especially by using natural powers or prayer

name: healthcare
trans: n. 医疗保健；健康护理，健康服务；卫生保健

sentences.english: The products are usually used in healthcare area and pharmaceutical area.
sentences.chinese: 产品通常用于在医疗保健领域和医药领域。

sentences.english: Why, with such a great healthcare system that promises the best care to everyone, would a person ever need to consult a search engine for an alternative?
sentences.chinese: 这样一个伟大的医疗保健系统许诺给每个人提供最好的照料，为什么还会有人求助于搜索引擎来寻找替代品？

sentences.english: They are the backbone of rural communities, and in many households they have the key responsibility for food security, education opportunities and healthcare.
sentences.chinese: 她们是农村社区的支柱，而且在许多家庭，她们负有粮食安全、教育机会和医疗保健的主要责任。

name: hearing
trans: n. 听力；审讯，听讯

sentences.english: a child with a hearing disability
sentences.chinese: 有听力障碍的儿童

detailed_translations.english: the sense which you use to hear sounds

name: heaven
trans: n. 天堂；天空；极乐

sentences.english: He believed that he and his wife would one day be together again in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。

sentences.english: He looked up towards the heavens.
sentences.chinese: 他仰望苍穹。

detailed_translations.english: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

name: heel
trans: n. 脚后跟；踵

sentences.english: black boots with high heels
sentences.chinese: 有高跟的黑靴子

detailed_translations.english: the curved back part of your foot
(of a vessel) to lean over; list

name: hell
trans: n. 地狱；究竟（作加强语气词）；训斥；黑暗势力

sentences.english: I’ve come one hell of a long way to get here.
sentences.chinese: 我走了老远的路才到这里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地狱；究竟（作加强语气词）；训斥；黑暗势力
detailed_translations.english: the place where the souls of bad people are believed to be punished after death, especially in the Christian and Muslim religions

detailed_translations.chinese: 该死；见鬼（表示惊奇、烦恼、厌恶、恼怒、失望等）
detailed_translations.english: used when you are very angry with someone

name: helmet
trans: n. 钢盔，头盔

sentences.english: The Sword split the Knight's helmet and bit him fatally.
sentences.chinese: 剑劈开了骑士的头盔并致命地刺进他。

sentences.english: Instead, he was told the last time that she loved him, got a hug from her, put his helmet on her so that she can live, and die himself...
sentences.chinese: 相反，他叫女孩最后一次说她爱他，最后一次拥抱他，并让她戴上自己的头盔，因而，女孩可以幸免于难，而他自己却离开了人世……

sentences.english: Without Christ we are defenseless against the Devil, but with "the helmet of salvation" our minds are protected by God.
sentences.chinese: 没有基督，我们无力防御魔鬼的攻击；但有救恩的头盔，我们的心思便有神的保护。

detailed_translations.english: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

name: hence
trans: adv. 因此；今后

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

name: herb
trans: n. 香草，药草

sentences.english: Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
sentences.chinese: 在菜肴上撒些切碎的新鲜香草。

detailed_translations.english: a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine

name: hesitate
trans: vt. 踌躇，犹豫；有疑虑，不愿意

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: hidden
trans: adj. 隐藏的

sentences.english: the use of hidden cameras
sentences.chinese: 隐藏式摄像机的使用

sentences.english: Some areas can hold hidden dangers for dogs.
sentences.chinese: 一些区域可能对狗有隐伏的危险。

sentences.english: the hidden meaning behind his words
sentences.chinese: 他的言外之意

sentences.english: Be on the lookout for hidden costs in hotel bills.
sentences.chinese: 小心酒店账单中有隐性收费。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to see or find

name: high
trans: n. 高水平；天空；由麻醉品引起的快感；高压地带

sentences.english: This is the highest mountain in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这是日本最高的山。

sentences.english: The camp was surrounded by a high fence.
sentences.chinese: 营地四周围着高高的栅栏。

sentences.english: a ten-foot high statue
sentences.chinese: 10英尺高的雕像

sentences.english: How high is the Eiffel Tower?
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔有多高？

sentences.english: He kicked the ball high into the air, over the heads of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他把球高高地踢向空中，越过了人群。

detailed_translations.english: measuring a long distance from the bottom to the top
at or to a level high above the ground, the floor etc

name: highway
trans: n. 公路，大路；捷径

sentences.english: Interstate Highway 75
sentences.chinese: 75号州际公路

detailed_translations.english: a wide main road that joins one town to another

name: hilarious
trans: adj. 欢闹的；非常滑稽的；喜不自禁的

sentences.english: The focus is solely on the shirts and the hilarious design.
sentences.chinese: 这些注意力完全放在衣服和欢闹的设计上了。

sentences.english: But I love my awful life so much right now, that I find it hilarious when I am unable to convince anyone else of it.
sentences.chinese: 即时它摧毁了我的家，但现在十分我喜欢我糟糕的生活，当我不能使其他人确信是我发现它是欢闹的。

name: hip
trans: n. 臀部；蔷薇果；忧郁

sentences.english: She stood there with her hands on her hips glaring at him.
sentences.chinese: 她站在那里，双手叉腰瞪着他。

sentences.english: The old lady had fallen and broken her hip.
sentences.chinese: 那老妇人摔了一跤，髋部骨折。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts on each side of your body between the top of your leg and your waist

detailed_translations.chinese: 熟悉内情的；非常时尚的
detailed_translations.english: doing things or done according to the latest fashion

name: hire
trans: n. 雇用，租用；租金，工钱

sentences.english: The best way to explore the island is to hire a car.
sentences.chinese: 在该岛寻幽访胜的最好方式就是租用一辆汽车。

sentences.english: What does it cost to hire a boat for a week?
sentences.chinese: 一艘小船租用一星期的费用是多少？

sentences.english: a car hire company
sentences.chinese: 汽车租赁公司

detailed_translations.english: to pay money to borrow something for a short period of time
an arrangement in which you pay a sum of money to borrow something for a short time

name: historian
trans: n. 历史学家

sentences.english: I am a historian, and I teach in an American university.
sentences.chinese: 我是一位历史学家，在美国一所大学任教。

sentences.english: "There’s nothing I can tell you about how [this or] any other incidents were or are handled, " CIA historian David Robarge said.
sentences.chinese: “关于[这一或]或任何其他事故是如何处理的，我没有什么可以告诉你的，”中央情报局历史学家大卫·罗巴尔说。

sentences.english: The historian drew a horizontal line on the date to remember it.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家在日期上画了一条水平线来记住这天。

detailed_translations.english: A historian is a person who specializes in the study of history, and who writes books and articles about it

name: hold
trans: n. 控制；保留

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

name: hollow
trans: n. 洞；山谷；窟窿

sentences.english: a hollow tree
sentences.chinese: 空心树

sentences.english: Any threat to bring in the police is a hollow one.
sentences.chinese: 任何要叫警察来的威胁都是虚张声势。

sentences.english: The steps were hollowed by centuries of use.
sentences.chinese: 经过几个世纪的踩踏，台阶上出现了凹痕

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的,中空的;；空洞的,无价值的
detailed_translations.english: having an empty space inside
to make the surface of something curve inwards

name: holy
trans: n. 神圣的东西

sentences.english: the holy city of Varanasi
sentences.chinese: 圣城瓦拉纳西

detailed_translations.english: connected with God and religion

name: homeless
trans: adj. 无家可归的

sentences.english: Thousands of people have been made homeless .
sentences.chinese: 成千上万人被逼得无家可归。

detailed_translations.english: without a home

name: honesty
trans: n. 诚实，正直

sentences.english: a politician of rare honesty and courage
sentences.chinese: 具备少见的诚实及勇气的政治家

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest

name: honour
trans: n. 荣誉；尊敬；勋章

sentences.english: He was showered with honours – among them an Oscar.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了很多荣誉–其中包括奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone with special respect

name: hook
trans: n. 挂钩，吊钩

sentences.english: We hooked the trailer to the back of the car.
sentences.chinese: 我们把拖车挂在汽车尾部。

sentences.english: a dress that hooks at the back
sentences.chinese: 从后背用钩扣的连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: to fasten or hang sth on sth else using a hook; to be fastened or hanging in this way

name: hopefully
trans: adv. 有希望地，有前途地

name: host
trans: n. [计] 主机；主人；主持人；许多

sentences.english: Which country is going to host the next World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 哪个国家将主办下一届世界杯？

detailed_translations.english: to provide the place and everything that is needed for an organized event

name: house
trans: n. 住宅；家庭；机构；议会；某种用途的建筑物

sentences.english: a four-bedroom house
sentences.chinese: 一幢有四间卧室的房子

sentences.english: America’s oldest publishing house
sentences.chinese: 美国历史最悠久的出版社

sentences.english: a small independent software house
sentences.chinese: 一家小型的独立软件公司

sentences.english: an auction house
sentences.chinese: 一家拍卖行

sentences.english: a famous Italian fashion house
sentences.chinese: 一家著名的意大利时装公司

detailed_translations.english: a building that someone lives in, especially one that has more than one level and is intended to be used by one family

name: household
trans: n. 全家人，一家人；(包括佣工在内的)家庭，户

sentences.english: household chores
sentences.chinese: 家务杂活

sentences.english: ...growing up in a male-only household.
sentences.chinese: …在全体成员均为男性的家庭里长大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭的， 家喻户晓的
detailed_translations.english: relating to looking after a house and the people in it
A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house

name: housing
trans: n. 房屋；住房供给；[机] 外壳；遮盖物；机器等的防护外壳或外罩

sentences.english: health problems caused by bad housing
sentences.chinese: 住房条件差引起的健康问题

sentences.english: a scheme to provide affordable housing for local people
sentences.chinese: 为当地民众提供平价住宅的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋， 住宅； 住房建筑， 住房供给； 外壳， 外罩
detailed_translations.english: the houses or conditions that people live in

name: humorous
trans: adj. 诙谐的，幽默的；滑稽的，可笑的

sentences.english: humorous stories
sentences.chinese: 诙谐的故事

sentences.english: The film has some mildly humorous moments.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影中有些略显幽默的片段。

detailed_translations.english: funny and enjoyable

name: humour
trans: n. 幽默（等于humor）；诙谐

sentences.english: his humour and charm
sentences.chinese: 他的幽默感和魅力

sentences.english: Greg’s feeble attempt at humour
sentences.chinese: 格雷格干巴巴的幽默

sentences.english: English humour
sentences.chinese: 英国式幽默

sentences.english: It’s vital to have a sense of humor in this job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作必须具备幽默感。

sentences.english: The host puts the contestants at ease with his own brand of humour .
sentences.chinese: 主持人以他别具一格的幽默让参赛者放松心情。

sentences.english: He showed flashes of humor that delighted the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他不时冒出些幽默话逗得观众忍俊不禁。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or tendency to think that things are funny, or funny things you say that show you have this ability
to do what someone wants or to pretend to agree with them so that they do not become upset

name: hunger
trans: n. 饿，饥饿；渴望

sentences.english: Try to satisfy your hunger by eating some fruit.
sentences.chinese: 吃些水果充充饥吧。

sentences.english: her hunger for knowledge
sentences.chinese: 她的求知欲

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you need to eat

name: hunt
trans: n. 狩猎；搜寻

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

name: hunting
trans: n. 打猎；追逐；搜索

name: hurt
trans: n. 痛苦；危害；痛苦的原因

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

name: hypothesis
trans: n. 假设

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: icon
trans: n. 图标；偶像；肖像，画像；圣像

sentences.english: To open a new file, click on the icon.
sentences.chinese: 要打开新文档，点击该图标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 图标；偶像；肖像，画像；圣像
detailed_translations.english: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation

name: ID
trans: 身份证件

name: ideal
trans: n. 理想；典范

sentences.english: advice on how to reach your ideal weight
sentences.chinese: 如何达到理想体重的建议

sentences.english: The scheme offers an ideal opportunity for youngsters to get training.
sentences.chinese: 该计划为年轻人提供了获得培训的极好机会。

sentences.english: With so much rain, conditions are far from ideal.
sentences.chinese: 雨水这么多，天气情况很不理想。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be
a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

name: identical
trans: n. 完全相同的事物

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: illusion
trans: n. 幻觉，错觉；错误的观念或信仰

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: illustrate
trans: vi. 举例

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: illustration
trans: n. 说明；插图；例证；图解

sentences.english: The book contains 62 pages of illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 这本书有62页插图。

detailed_translations.english: a picture in a book, article etc, especially one that helps you to understand it

name: imagination
trans: n. [心理] 想象力；空想；幻想物

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

name: immigration
trans: n. 外来移民；移居

sentences.english: He called for a common European policy on immigration.
sentences.chinese: 他要求欧洲国家实施共同的移民政策。

detailed_translations.english: the process of entering another country in order to live there permanently

name: immune
trans: n. 免疫者；免除者

sentences.english: Once we’ve had the disease, we’re immune for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦得过这种病，就获得了终身免疫力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 免疫的， 有免疫力的， 不受影响的； 免除的， 豁免的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immune to a particular disease cannot catch it

name: impatient
trans: adj. 焦躁的；不耐心的

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

name: implement
trans: n. 工具，器具；手段

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: implication
trans: n. 含义；暗示；牵连，卷入；可能的结果，影响

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: imply
trans: vt. 意味；暗示；隐含

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: impose
trans: vt. 强加；征税；以…欺骗

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: impress
trans: n. 印象，印记；特征，痕迹

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: impressed
trans: adj. 印象深刻的；外加的；受感动的；了不起的

detailed_translations.chinese: 被打动的， 被感动的

name: incentive
trans: n. 动机；刺激

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: inch
trans: n. 英寸；身高；少许

sentences.english: The curtains were an inch too short.
sentences.chinese: 窗帘短了一英寸。

sentences.english: Rainfall here is under 15 inches a year.
sentences.chinese: 本地的年降雨量不到15英寸。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

name: incident
trans: n. 事件，事变；插曲

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

name: income
trans: n. 收入，收益；所得

sentences.english: low-income families
sentences.chinese: 低收入家庭

detailed_translations.english: the money that you earn from your work or that you receive from investments, the government etc

name: incorporate
trans: vt. 包含，吸收；体现；把……合并

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: incorrect
trans: adj. 错误的，不正确的；不适当的；不真实的

sentences.english: The information you gave us was incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 你给我们的信息不准确。

detailed_translations.english: not correct or true

name: increasingly
trans: adv. 越来越多地；渐增地

sentences.english: Marketing techniques are becoming increasingly sophisticated.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.english: Increasingly, young people distrust all forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人越来越不相信任何形式的政府。

detailed_translations.english: more and more all the time

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: index
trans: n. 指标；指数；索引；指针

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

name: indication
trans: n. 指示，指出；迹象；象征

sentences.english: Could you give me some indication as to when I am likely to receive a reply?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我透露一下什么时候我能收到回复吗？

sentences.english: Indications are that the situation hasn’t improved much.
sentences.chinese: 迹象表明局势并没有多大好转。

sentences.english: There is every indication (= there are very clear signs ) that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是真的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
detailed_translations.english: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

name: industrial
trans: n. 工业股票；工业工人

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 必然的，不可避免的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: inevitably
trans: adv. 不可避免地；必然地

sentences.english: The decision will inevitably lead to political tensions.
sentences.chinese: 该决定必然导致政治局势的紧张。

sentences.english: Inevitably, the situation did not please everyone.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况必定不能让所有人都感到满意。

detailed_translations.english: used for saying that something is certain to happen and cannot be avoided

name: infection
trans: n. 感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: infer
trans: vi. 推断；作出推论

sentences.english: A lot can be inferred from these statistics.
sentences.chinese: 根据这些统计资料可以推断出很多事情。

sentences.english: From the evidence, we can infer that the victim knew her killer.
sentences.chinese: 根据证据我们可以推断出受害者认识凶手。

detailed_translations.english: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

name: inflation
trans: n. 膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: info
trans: n. 信息；情报

name: inform
trans: vi. 告发；告密

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: inhabitant
trans: n. 居民；居住者

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: inherit
trans: vt. 继承；遗传而得

sentences.english: inherited wealth
sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: initial
trans: n. 词首大写字母

sentences.english: an initial investment of £5,000
sentences.chinese: 5,000英镑的初始投资

sentences.english: The initial response has been encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 最初的反应情况很乐观。

detailed_translations.english: happening at the beginning
the first letter of someone’s first name

name: initially
trans: adv. 最初，首先；开头

sentences.english: Stan initially wanted to go to medical school.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦最初想进医学院。

sentences.english: Initially, I thought I would only stay there a year.
sentences.chinese: 起初，我以为我只会在那儿待一年。

detailed_translations.english: at the beginning

name: initiative
trans: n. 主动权；首创精神

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

name: ink
trans: n. 墨水，墨汁；油墨

sentences.english: Please write in black ink.
sentences.chinese: 请用黑色墨水书写。

detailed_translations.english: a coloured liquid that you use for writing, printing or drawing

name: inner
trans: n. 内部

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

name: innovation
trans: n. 创新，革新；新方法

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: innovative
trans: adj. 革新的，创新的；新颖的；有创新精神的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: input
trans: n. 投入；输入电路

sentences.english: to input text/data/figures
sentences.chinese: 把文本 / 数据 / 数字输入计算机

sentences.english: data input
sentences.chinese: 数据输入

detailed_translations.english: to put information into a computer
the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in

name: inquiry
trans: n. 探究；调查；质询

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: insert
trans: n. 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片

sentences.english: He took a small key from his pocket and slowly inserted it into the lock.
sentences.chinese: 他从衣袋里掏出一把小钥匙，然后缓缓地将其插入锁孔里。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside or into something else

detailed_translations.chinese: 插入物；管芯；镶块；[机械]刀片
detailed_translations.english: something that is designed to be put inside something else

name: insight
trans: n. 洞察力；洞悉

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: insist
trans: vi. 坚持，强调

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

name: inspector
trans: n. 检查员；巡视员

sentences.english: ticket inspectors
sentences.chinese: 查票员

sentences.english: a Health and Safety inspector
sentences.chinese: 健康安全督察员

sentences.english: Standards of discipline at the school were strongly criticized in the inspector’s report.
sentences.chinese: 督察员在报告里狠狠地批评了这所学校的纪律水准。

detailed_translations.english: an official whose job is to check that something is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: install
trans: vt. 安装；任命；安顿

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

name: installation
trans: n. 安装，装置；就职

sentences.english: the installation and maintenance of alarm systems
sentences.chinese: 警报系统的安装和维护

sentences.english: The whole computer installation was nearly new.
sentences.chinese: 整套电脑设备几乎是全新的。

sentences.english: nuclear installations
sentences.chinese: 核设施

detailed_translations.english: when someone fits a piece of equipment somewhere

name: instance
trans: n. 实例；情况；建议

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

name: instant
trans: n. 瞬间；立即；片刻

sentences.english: an instant success
sentences.chinese: 马到成功

sentences.english: a system that provides instant access to client information
sentences.chinese: 能立即查到客户信息的系统

sentences.english: The women took an instant dislike to one another.
sentences.chinese: 这些女人立刻就彼此厌恶起来。

sentences.english: The programme brought an instant response.
sentences.chinese: 节目立即引起了反响。

sentences.english: For an instant, Barney was tempted to flee.
sentences.chinese: 那一瞬间，巴尼很想逃走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 立即的； 紧急的； 可以速食的
detailed_translations.english: happening or produced immediately
An instant is an extremely short period of time

name: instantly
trans: conj. 一…就…

sentences.english: All four victims died instantly.
sentences.chinese: 四名受害人全部当即死亡。

sentences.english: The information was instantly available.
sentences.chinese: 信息即时可得。

detailed_translations.english: immediately

name: institute
trans: n. 学会，协会；学院

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: institution
trans: n. 制度；建立；（社会或宗教等）公共机构；习俗

sentences.english: powerful institutions such as world banks
sentences.chinese: 诸如世界银行之类的强大机构

sentences.english: the Institution of Electrical Engineers
sentences.chinese: 电机工程师学会

detailed_translations.english: a large organization that has a particular kind of work or purpose

name: insurance
trans: n. 保险；保险费；保险契约；赔偿金

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: integrate
trans: n. 一体化；集成体

sentences.english: These programs can be integrated with your existing software.
sentences.chinese: 这些程序能和你的已有的软件整合成一体。

detailed_translations.english: to combine two or more things so that they work together; to combine with sth else in this way

name: intellectual
trans: n. 知识分子；凭理智做事者

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intended
trans: n. 已订婚者

name: intense
trans: adj. 强烈的；紧张的；非常的；热情的

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

name: interact
trans: n. 幕间剧；幕间休息

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: interaction
trans: n. 相互作用；[数] 交互作用

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.english: The real power of the concept comes not from any one of these devices; it emerges from the interaction of all of them.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

detailed_translations.english: a process by which two or more things affect each other

name: internal
trans: n. 内脏；本质

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: interpret
trans: vi. 解释；翻译

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: interpretation
trans: n. 解释；翻译；演出

sentences.english: One possible interpretation is that they want you to resign.
sentences.chinese: 一种可能的解释是，他们想要你辞职。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to put an accurate interpretation on (= explain ) the survey results.
sentences.chinese: 对调查结果难以作出确切的解释。

sentences.english: What exactly the author meant by that statement is open to interpretation (= able to be understood or explained in different ways ).
sentences.chinese: 作者这句话的确切含义可有各种理解。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc

name: interrupt
trans: n. 中断

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

name: interval
trans: n. 间隔；间距；幕间休息

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

name: invade
trans: vt. 侵略；侵袭；侵扰；涌入

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: invasion
trans: n. 入侵，侵略；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

name: investigation
trans: n. 调查；调查研究

sentences.english: The investigation continued for nearly three years.
sentences.chinese: 调查持续了近三年。

sentences.english: a criminal investigation
sentences.chinese: 刑事调查

sentences.english: A private detective was hired to conduct the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 雇了一名私人侦探进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: investment
trans: n. 投资；投入；封锁

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

name: investor
trans: n. 投资者

sentences.english: The main investor in the project is the French bank Credit National.
sentences.chinese: 该项目的主要投资方是法国国民信贷银行。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money to a company, business, or bank in order to get a profit

name: isolate
trans: n. [生物] 隔离种群

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: isolated
trans: adj. 孤立的；分离的；单独的；[电] 绝缘的

sentences.english: small isolated communities
sentences.chinese: 偏僻的小社区

sentences.english: Not many people visit this isolated spot.
sentences.chinese: 没有多少人到这个偏僻的地方来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 隔离的， 分离的； 与世隔绝的， 偏僻的； 孤立的， 孤独的； 个别的
detailed_translations.english: an isolated building, village etc is far away from any others

name: issue
trans: n. 问题；流出；期号；发行物

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

name: jail
trans: n. 监狱；监牢；拘留所

sentences.english: He’s been in jail for three months already.
sentences.chinese: 他已经入狱三个月。

detailed_translations.english: a place where criminals are kept as part of their punishment, or where people who have been charged with a crime are kept before they are judged in a law court

name: jet
trans: n. 喷射，喷嘴；喷气式飞机；黑玉

sentences.english: He owns a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 他拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷射，喷嘴；喷气式飞机；黑玉
detailed_translations.english: a fast plane with a jet engine

name: joint
trans: n. 关节；接缝；接合处，接合点；（牛，羊等的腿）大块肉

sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

detailed_translations.english: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

name: journalism
trans: n. 新闻业，新闻工作；报章杂志

sentences.english: a career in journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.english: The hospital has been the target of investigative journalism(= journalism that examines an event or situation in order to find out the truth ).
sentences.chinese: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of writing news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: joy
trans: n. 欢乐，快乐；乐趣；高兴

sentences.english: the look of joy on her face
sentences.chinese: 她脸上的喜悦表情

sentences.english: The garden was his pride and joy.
sentences.chinese: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

detailed_translations.english: great happiness and pleasure

name: judgement
trans: n. 意见；判断力；[法] 审判；评价

sentences.english: He trusted in his judgement.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他的判断。

sentences.english: All action is based on judgement.
sentences.chinese: 一切行动均以判断为基础。

sentences.english: The judgement is often biased by interest.
sentences.chinese: 判断往往因利害关系而有偏差。

name: junior
trans: adj. 年少的；后进的；下级的

sentences.english: She now lives with actor Denis Lawson, 10 years her junior.
sentences.chinese: 她现在和比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

detailed_translations.english: If you are someone's junior, you are younger than they are

name: jury
trans: n. [法] 陪审团；评判委员会

sentences.english: the members of the jury
sentences.chinese: 陪审团成员

sentences.english: The jury found him not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定他无罪。

sentences.english: the right to trial by jury
sentences.chinese: 由陪审团进行审理的权利

detailed_translations.english: a group of 12 ordinary people who listen to the details of a case in court and decide whether someone is guilty or not

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: justify
trans: vi. 证明合法；整理版面

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: kit
trans: n. 工具箱；成套工具

sentences.english: Sally keeps her make-up kit in her bag.
sentences.chinese: 萨莉把化妆包放在手提包里。

sentences.english: a bike repair kit
sentences.chinese: 一套自行车修理工具

sentences.english: a shaving kit
sentences.chinese: 一套剃须用具

sentences.english: a drum kit
sentences.chinese: 一套架子鼓

detailed_translations.english: a set of tools, equipment etc that you use for a particular purpose or activity

name: labour
trans: n. （英国）工党

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

name: ladder
trans: n. 阶梯；途径；梯状物

sentences.english: She climbed up the ladder.
sentences.chinese: 她爬上梯子。

sentences.english: He hurt himself falling off a ladder.
sentences.chinese: 他从梯子上摔下来受了伤。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for climbing up to or down from high places. A ladder has two bars that are connected by rungs(= short bars that you use as steps ) .

name: landing
trans: n. 登陆；码头；楼梯平台

sentences.english: take-off and landing procedures
sentences.chinese: 起降程序

sentences.english: the Apollo Moon landings
sentences.chinese: 阿波罗宇宙飞船登月

detailed_translations.english: the action of bringing an aircraft down to the ground after being in the air

name: landscape
trans: n. 风景；风景画；景色；山水画；乡村风景画；地形；（文件的）横向打印格式

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

name: lane
trans: n. 小巷；[航][水运] 航线；车道；罚球区

sentences.english: a quiet country lane
sentences.chinese: 一条宁静的乡间小路

sentences.english: ...after being disqualified for running out of his lane in the 200 metres.
sentences.chinese: …在200米比赛中由于冲出跑道而被取消比赛资格以后。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow road in the countryside

name: largely
trans: adv. 主要地；大部分；大量地

sentences.english: The state of Nevada is largely desert.
sentences.chinese: 内华达州大部分是沙漠。

sentences.english: It had been a tiring day, largely because of all the tedious waiting.
sentences.chinese: 那一天真累人，主要是因为等得无聊。

detailed_translations.english: mostly or mainly

name: lately
trans: adv. 近来，不久前

sentences.english: What have you been doing lately?
sentences.chinese: 你最近在干什么？

sentences.english: Lately, I’ve had trouble sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 最近我睡眠有问题。

detailed_translations.english: recently

name: latest
trans: adv. 最迟地；最后地

sentences.english: He telephoned me the latest news.
sentences.chinese: 他打电话告诉我最新的消息。

sentences.english: His latest novel was cut up by the reviewers.
sentences.chinese: 他的最新小说被评论家批得体无完肤。

sentences.english: In order to prove his point he showed them the latest sales figures.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明他的观点，他给他们看了最新的销售数字。

detailed_translations.english: the most recent or newest thing

detailed_translations.chinese: 最新的，最近的；最迟的，最后的
detailed_translations.english: the most recent or the newest

name: launch
trans: vt. 发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使…下水

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: leadership
trans: n. 领导能力；领导阶层

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

name: leaflet
trans: n. 小叶；传单

sentences.english: a leaflet on skin cancer
sentences.chinese: 有关皮肤癌的宣传页

sentences.english: Students were handing out election leaflets at the station.
sentences.chinese: 学生在车站分发选举传单。

detailed_translations.english: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

name: league
trans: n. 联盟；社团；范畴

sentences.english: the National Socialist League
sentences.chinese: 国家社会主义联盟

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or countries who have joined together because they have similar aims, political beliefs etc

name: lean
trans: vi. 倾斜；倚靠；倾向；依赖

sentences.english: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.english: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

detailed_translations.english: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

name: leave
trans: vt. 离开；留下；遗忘；委托

sentences.english: My baby gets upset when I leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 我一离开房间宝宝就会不安。

sentences.english: Before leaving the train, make sure you have all your belongings with you.
sentences.chinese: 下火车前一定要带好随身物品。

sentences.english: Leave the motorway at Junction 7.
sentences.chinese: 请在七号交叉路口驶离高速公路。

sentences.english: My youngest boy has not left my side (= has stayed near me ) since his daddy was killed.
sentences.chinese: 我最小的儿子自从他爸爸死后就没有离开过我的身边。

detailed_translations.english: to go away from a place or a person
to go away from a place or a person

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: lens
trans: n. 透镜，镜头；眼睛中的水晶体；晶状体；隐形眼镜；汽车的灯玻璃

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

name: level
trans: n. 水平；标准；水平面

sentences.english: Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
sentences.chinese: 手臂应该与桌子齐平。

sentences.english: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的地面不是完全平整的。

detailed_translations.english: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object
flat and not sloping in any direction

name: licence
trans: n. 许可证，执照；特许

sentences.english: The dealers applied for an export licence.
sentences.chinese: 经销商申请了出口许可证。

sentences.english: He was arrested for driving without a license.
sentences.chinese: 他因无照驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: The Tennessee Valley Authority applied for a license to operate the facility.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西河谷管理局申请了这个场所的经营执照。

sentences.english: The owner of land could grant a licence to cut and remove timber.
sentences.chinese: 土地所有者可发执照授权砍伐和运走木材。

sentences.english: I forgot to renew my licence.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记去办理执照展期了。

sentences.english: Persistent offenders face losing their licence.
sentences.chinese: 多次违规者将会被没收执照。

detailed_translations.english: an official document giving you permission to own or do something for a period of time

name: lifetime
trans: n. 一生；寿命；终生；使用期

sentences.english: It’s the sort of opportunity you see only once in a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 这种机会你一辈子也只能碰到一次。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which someone is alive or something exists

name: lighting
trans: n. 照明设备，舞台灯光

sentences.english: Better street lighting might help to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 改善街道照明或许有助于减少犯罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照明； 照明设备； 光线
detailed_translations.english: the lights that light a room, building, or street, or the quality of the light produced

name: likewise
trans: adv. 同样地；也

sentences.english: Nanny put on a shawl and told the girls to do likewise.
sentences.chinese: 南妮披上披肩，并叫女孩们也这样做。

sentences.english: The clams were delicious. Likewise, the eggplant was excellent.
sentences.chinese: 蛤蜊味道鲜美，茄子也同样美味。

sentences.english: ‘You’re always welcome at our house.’ ‘Likewise.’
sentences.chinese: “欢迎你随时来我家做客。”“你也一样。

detailed_translations.english: in the same way

name: limitation
trans: n. 限制；限度；极限；追诉时效；有效期限；缺陷

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

name: limited
trans: adj. 有限的

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
