detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: medal
trans: n. 勋章，奖章；纪念章

sentences.english: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

name: medication
trans: n. 药物；药物治疗；药物处理

sentences.english: When somebody comes for treatment I always ask them if they are on any medication.
sentences.chinese: 有人来治疗时，我总是会问他们是否在服药。

detailed_translations.chinese: 药物；药物治疗；药物处理
detailed_translations.english: medicine or drugs given to people who are ill

name: medium
trans: adj. 中间的，中等的；半生熟的

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

name: melt
trans: vi. 熔化，溶解；渐混

sentences.english: It was warmer now, and the snow was beginning to melt.
sentences.chinese: 现在天气暖和了，雪开始融化。

sentences.english: Melt the butter in a saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 把黄油放在深平底锅里化开。

detailed_translations.english: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

name: membership
trans: n. 资格；成员资格；会员身份

sentences.english: You should carry your membership card with you at all times.
sentences.chinese: 你应该随身携带会员卡。

sentences.english: Membership fees are being increased this year.
sentences.chinese: 会费今年提高了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会员身份， 会籍； 全体会员， 会员数
detailed_translations.english: when someone is a member of a club, group, or organization

name: memorable
trans: adj. 显著的，难忘的；值得纪念的

sentences.english: We want to make this a truly memorable day for the children.
sentences.chinese: 我们想让今天成为孩子们永远难忘的日子。

detailed_translations.english: very good, enjoyable, or unusual, and worth remembering

name: metaphor
trans: n. 暗喻，隐喻；比喻说法

sentences.english: She uses some wonderful images and metaphors in her writing.
sentences.chinese: 她在作品中用了一些绝妙的比喻和暗喻。

sentences.english: a very creative use of metaphor
sentences.chinese: 隐喻的独到运用

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by referring to it as something different and suggesting that it has similar qualities to that thing

name: military
trans: adj. 军事的；军人的；适于战争的

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: miner
trans: n. 矿工；开矿机

sentences.english: Therefore, we should be more like a miner to stand in reality, excavate off wastes, and get gold mines.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们更应该像一个矿工一样为执著于现实，挖开渣滓，淘出金矿。

sentences.english: From the standpoint of know-how the only difference between the miner of graphite in Ceylon and the logger in Oregon is in the type of know-how.
sentences.chinese: 从知道者的立场来看所谓的知道之间的不同不过是锡兰的矿工之于石墨和俄勒冈的伐木工人之间在某一类别的知道而已。

sentences.english: A miner bought food from a makeshift shop set up in the trunk of a car near a roadblock by striking miners.
sentences.chinese: 一位矿工从搭建在车厢中的临时食品店中购买食物，附近的道路都被罢工的矿工们设置了路障。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works under the ground in a mine to remove coal, gold etc

name: mineral
trans: n. 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

name: minimum
trans: n. 最小值；最低限度；最小化；最小量

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

name: minister
trans: n. 部长；大臣；牧师

sentences.english: a senior Cabinet minister
sentences.chinese: 资深的内阁部长

sentences.english: He concluded a deal with the Danish minister in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 他在华盛顿与丹麦公使达成了一项协议。

detailed_translations.english: a politician who is in charge of a government depart-ment, in Britain and some other countries

name: minor
trans: adj. 未成年的；次要的；较小的；小调的；二流的

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

name: minority
trans: n. 少数民族；少数派；未成年

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

name: miserable
trans: adj. 悲惨的；痛苦的；卑鄙的

sentences.english: I’ve been so miserable since Pat left me.
sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.english: I spent the weekend feeling miserable .
sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy, for example because you feel lonely, cold, or badly treated

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: mistake
trans: n. 错误；误会；过失

sentences.english: The most common mistake is to plant them too deep.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的错误就是把它们种得太深了。

sentences.english: She mistook my meaning entirely.
sentences.chinese: 她完全误解了我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that has been done in the wrong way, or an opinion or statement that is incorrect
to understand something wrongly

name: mixed
trans: adj. 混合的；形形色色的；弄糊涂的

name: mode
trans: n. 模式；方式；风格；时尚

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: model
trans: n. 模型；典型；模范；模特儿；样式

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

name: modest
trans: adj. 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: modify
trans: vt. 修改，修饰；更改

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: monitor
trans: n. 监视器；监听器；监控器；显示屏；班长

sentences.english: a heart monitor
sentences.chinese: 心脏监测仪

detailed_translations.chinese: 班长；监视器，检测器；显示器
detailed_translations.english: a television or part of a computer with a screen, on which you can see pictures or information
to carefully watch and check a situation in order to see how it changes over a period of time

name: monster
trans: n. 怪物；巨人，巨兽；残忍的人

sentences.english: the remains of a prehistoric monster
sentences.chinese: 史前怪兽的遗骸

sentences.english: the search for the Loch Ness Monster
sentences.chinese: 对内斯湖水怪的搜寻

detailed_translations.chinese: 怪物；巨人，巨兽；残忍的人
detailed_translations.english: an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening
unusually large

name: monthly
trans: adj. 每月的，每月一次的；有效期为一个月的

sentences.english: The mortgage is payable in monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款每月分期偿还。

sentences.english: a monthly publication
sentences.chinese: 月刊

sentences.english: In some areas the property price can rise monthly.
sentences.chinese: 有些地区，房价能每月都涨。

sentences.english: They meet monthly to discuss progress.
sentences.chinese: 他们每月碰一次头讨论进展情况。

sentences.english: a leading women’s monthly
sentences.chinese: 一本主要的女性月刊

detailed_translations.english: happening once a month
every month or once a month
a magazine that appears once a month

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: moral
trans: adj. 道德的；精神上的；品性端正的

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: moreover
trans: adv. 而且；此外

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: mortgage
trans: vt. 抵押

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: mosque
trans: n. 清真寺

sentences.english: Would you go to church or the synagogue or the mosque?
sentences.chinese: 你会去教堂，犹太教会，或者清真寺吗？

sentences.english: If there is to be a new city church, they argue, then why not a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 他们置疑说，如果要修建一个新的城市教堂为什么不能是座清真寺呢？

sentences.english: Tell the congregation of a church or mosque that existence is too vulgar an attribute to fasten onto their God, and they will brand you an atheist.
sentences.chinese: 告诉教堂或清真寺的会众们，存在，是强加在他们的上帝身上的一种过于庸俗的属性，他们将会指责你为无神论者。

detailed_translations.english: a building in which Muslims worship

name: motion
trans: n. 动作；移动；手势；请求；意向；议案

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: motivate
trans: vt. 刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: motivation
trans: n. 动机；积极性；推动

name: motor
trans: n. 发动机，马达；汽车

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

name: mount
trans: vt. 增加；爬上；使骑上马；安装，架置；镶嵌，嵌入；准备上演；成立（军队等）

sentences.english: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他登上楼梯，慢慢环顾四周。

sentences.english: Mount Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: to go up a step or stairs
used as part of the name of a mountain

name: moving
trans: adj. 移动的；动人的；活动的

sentences.english: Attending the memorial service was a moving experience .
sentences.chinese: 参加这次追悼仪式是一次十分感人的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel strong emotions, especially sadness or sympathy

name: multiple
trans: adj. 多重的；多样的；许多的

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

name: multiply
trans: vt. 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: mysterious
trans: adj. 神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: naked
trans: adj. 裸体的；无装饰的；无证据的；直率的

sentences.english: The children ran naked through the yard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们光着身子跑过院子。

sentences.english: a picture of a naked man
sentences.chinese: 裸体男子的照片

sentences.english: They found the body lying half naked in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现尸体半裸着躺在草丛中。

sentences.english: The governor ordered the prisoner to be stripped naked and whipped.
sentences.chinese: 监狱长下令将那个犯人剥光衣服进行鞭笞。

detailed_translations.english: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes

name: narrow
trans: adj. 狭窄的，有限的；勉强的；精密的；度量小的

sentences.english: The stairs were very narrow.
sentences.chinese: 楼梯非常狭窄。

sentences.english: a long, narrow band of cloud
sentences.chinese: 窄长的云带

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

name: nasty
trans: adj. 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: national
trans: adj. 国家的；国民的；民族的；国立的

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

name: navigation
trans: n. 航行；航海

sentences.english: compasses and other instruments of navigation
sentences.chinese: 罗盘及其他导航仪器

detailed_translations.chinese: 航行， 航海， 航空； 导航， 领航
detailed_translations.english: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another

name: nearby
trans: adj. 附近的，邻近的

sentences.english: Lucy was staying in the nearby town of Hamilton.
sentences.chinese: 露西当时住在附近的汉密尔顿镇。

sentences.english: He might easily have been seen by someone who lived nearby.
sentences.chinese: 他可能很容易被住在附近的人看到。

sentences.english: The helicopter crashed to earth nearby.
sentences.chinese: 直升机坠毁在附近的地面上。

detailed_translations.english: not far away
a short distance from sb/sth; not far away

name: neat
trans: adj. 灵巧的；整洁的；优雅的；齐整的；未搀水的；平滑的

sentences.english: neat handwriting
sentences.chinese: 工整的笔迹

sentences.english: His clothes were always neat and clean.
sentences.chinese: 他的衣服总是很整洁。

sentences.english: Everything in the house was neat and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 房子里的每样物品都干净整齐。

sentences.english: She arranged the books in a nice neat pile.
sentences.chinese: 她把书摞成整齐的一堆。

detailed_translations.english: tidy and carefully arranged

name: necessity
trans: n. 需要；必然性；必需品

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: negative
trans: adj. [数] 负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: negotiation
trans: n. 谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: nerve
trans: n. 神经；勇气；[植] 叶脉

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: neutral
trans: adj. 中立的，中性的；中立国的；非彩色的

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.english: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

sentences.english: the neutral language of an official news report
sentences.chinese: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

detailed_translations.english: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement

name: nevertheless
trans: adv. 然而，不过；虽然如此

sentences.english: What you said was true. It was, nevertheless, a little unkind.
sentences.chinese: 你说的都是实话，只不过有点刻薄。

sentences.english: Although the market has been flat, residential property costs remain high. Nevertheless, the fall-off in demand has had an impact on resale values.
sentences.chinese: 尽管市场一直疲软，房价持续偏高。然而需求的减少还是对二手房价格产生了影响。

detailed_translations.english: You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said.
in spite of a fact that you have just mentioned

name: newly
trans: adv. 最近；重新；以新的方式

sentences.english: She was young at the time, and newly married.
sentences.chinese: 那时她还年轻，刚结婚。

detailed_translations.english: recently

name: nightmare
trans: n. 恶梦；梦魇般的经历

sentences.english: a recurring nightmare
sentences.chinese: 一再出现的噩梦

detailed_translations.english: a very frightening dream

name: norm
trans: n. 标准，规范

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: notebook
trans: n. 笔记本，笔记簿；手册

sentences.english: Copy this page in your notebook.
sentences.chinese: 把这一页抄到你的笔记本上。

sentences.english: She rummaged in the desk drawers for her notebook.
sentences.chinese: 她在书桌抽屉里翻找她的笔记本。

sentences.english: She immediately copied the letter in her notebook.
sentences.chinese: 她立即把这封信抄在她的笔记本里。

detailed_translations.english: a book made of plain paper on which you can write notes

name: notion
trans: n. 概念；见解；打算

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: novelist
trans: n. 小说家

sentences.english: The key to success as a romantic novelist is absolute belief in your story.
sentences.chinese: 一个浪漫派小说家成功的关键在于对自己故事的绝对信念。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes novels

name: nowadays
trans: adv. 现今；时下

sentences.english: Nowadays people are rarely shocked by the sex they see on television.
sentences.chinese: 如今人们在电视上看见性爱镜头不太会感到吃惊了。

sentences.english: Most people nowadays are aware of the importance of a healthy diet.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都明白健康饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: now, compared with what happened in the past

name: numerous
trans: adj. 许多的，很多的

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: nursing
trans: n. 护理；看护；养育

sentences.english: I’d love to go into nursing.
sentences.chinese: 我很乐意从事护理行业。

sentences.english: the nursing profession
sentences.chinese: 护理专业

sentences.english: psychiatric nursing
sentences.chinese: 精神病人的护理

detailed_translations.english: the job or skill of looking after people who are ill, injured, or old

name: nutrition
trans: n. 营养，营养学；营养品

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: obesity
trans: n. 肥大，肥胖

sentences.english: So, what of the future of obesity in America?
sentences.chinese: 那么，未来美国的肥胖状况会怎么发展呢？

sentences.english: Dr.Watson is great on exercise as a cure for obesity.
sentences.chinese: 沃森医生把运动看做是治疗肥胖症的良方。

sentences.english: What is obesity?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肥胖？

detailed_translations.english: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

name: obey
trans: vt. 服从，听从；按照……行动

sentences.english: The little boy made no effort to obey.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩不肯服从。

sentences.english: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
sentences.chinese: “坐下！”他说道，那只狗马上就服从了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

name: object
trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: objective
trans: adj. 客观的；目标的；宾格的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: obligation
trans: n. 义务；职责；债务

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: observation
trans: n. 观察；监视；观察报告

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: observe
trans: vt. 庆祝

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: observer
trans: n. 观察者；[天] 观测者；遵守者

sentences.english: political observers
sentences.chinese: 政治观察员

sentences.english: Observers are predicting a fall in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 观察员预测利率会下降。

detailed_translations.english: someone who regularly watches or pays attention to particular things, events, situations etc

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，干扰；妨害物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: obtain
trans: vi. 获得；流行

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: occasionally
trans: adv. 偶尔；间或

sentences.english: Occasionally Alice would look up from her books.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯偶尔会从书中抬起头来。

name: occupation
trans: n. 职业；占有；消遣；占有期

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

name: occupy
trans: vt. 占据，占领；居住；使忙碌

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: offence
trans: n. 犯罪；违反；过错；攻击

sentences.english: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

name: offend
trans: vt. 冒犯；使…不愉快

sentences.english: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
sentences.chinese: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

sentences.english: The careful language is designed not to offend.
sentences.chinese: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

sentences.english: In Western countries girls are far less likely to offend than boys.
sentences.chinese: 在西方国家，女孩们远不像男孩们那样容易犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
to commit a crime or crimes

name: offender
trans: n. 罪犯；冒犯者；违法者

sentences.english: Community punishment is used for less serious offenders.
sentences.chinese: 社区服务刑被用来处罚犯罪情节较轻者。

sentences.english: At 16, Scott was already a persistent offender (= someone who has been caught several times for committing crimes ).
sentences.chinese: 斯科特16岁时就已经是个惯犯了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is guilty of a crime

name: offensive
trans: adj. 攻击的；冒犯的；无礼的；讨厌的

sentences.english: I found her remarks deeply offensive.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的话令人非常恼火。

sentences.english: offensive behaviour
sentences.chinese: 无礼的行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 冒犯的，无礼的；进攻的，攻击性的
detailed_translations.english: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people
a planned military attack involving large forces over a long period

name: official
trans: adj. 官方的；正式的；公务的

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

name: ongoing
trans: adj. 不间断的，进行的；前进的

sentences.english: their ongoing search for a new director
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任

sentences.english: ongoing negotiations
sentences.chinese: 还在进行的谈判

sentences.english: The discussions are still ongoing.
sentences.chinese: 讨论仍在继续。

detailed_translations.english: continuing, or continuing to develop

name: opening
trans: n. 开始；机会；通路；空缺的职位

sentences.english: the opening match of the season
sentences.chinese: 本赛季的首场比赛

sentences.english: the opening chapter of the book
sentences.chinese: 本书的第一章

sentences.english: at the opening of the trial
sentences.chinese: 审判伊始

detailed_translations.english: first or beginning
the beginning or first part of something

name: openly
trans: adv. 公开地；公然地；坦率地

sentences.english: Sarah talked openly about her problems.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉毫不掩饰地说起自己的问题。

sentences.english: He was openly critical of his colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 他公开批评自己的同事。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that does not hide your feelings, opinions, or the facts

name: opera
trans: n. 歌剧；歌剧院；歌剧团

sentences.english: We go to the opera (= go to a performance of opera ) regularly.
sentences.chinese: 我们常去听歌剧。

sentences.english: an opera singer
sentences.chinese: 歌剧演员

detailed_translations.english: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

name: operate
trans: vi. 运转；动手术；起作用

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: operator
trans: n. 经营者；操作员；话务员；行家

sentences.english: Hello, operator? Could you put me through to Room 31?
sentences.chinese: 喂，接线员吗？请帮我接31号房间。

sentences.english: computers which can be used by untrained operators
sentences.chinese: 未经训练的操作者也可使用的电脑

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a telephone switchboard, who you can call for help

name: opponent
trans: n. 对手；反对者；敌手

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: oppose
trans: vt. 反对；对抗，抗争

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: opposed
trans: adj. 相反的；敌对的

sentences.english: I am utterly opposed to any form of terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 我坚决反对任何形式的恐怖主义。

sentences.english: The principles of capitalism and socialism are diametrically opposed (= completely opposite ).
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的原则与社会主义的原则截然相反。

detailed_translations.english: If you are opposed to something, you disagree with it or disapprove of it.

name: opposition
trans: n. 反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: orchestra
trans: n. 管弦乐队；乐队演奏处

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

name: organ
trans: n. [生物] 器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: organic
trans: adj. [有化] 有机的；组织的；器官的；根本的

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

name: origin
trans: n. 起源；原点；出身；开端

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: otherwise
trans: adv. 否则；另外；在其他方面

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果，结局；成果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: outer
trans: adj. 外面的，外部的；远离中心的

sentences.english: His inner conflict is related to struggles in the outer world.
sentences.chinese: 他内心的矛盾和外部世界的争斗有关。

detailed_translations.english: relating to objects, activities etc that are part of the world, as opposed to your own thoughts and feelings

name: outfit
trans: n. 机构；用具；全套装备

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion
to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose

name: outline
trans: n. 轮廓；大纲；概要；略图

sentences.english: a research proposal outline
sentences.chinese: 研究计划梗概

detailed_translations.english: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

name: output
trans: n. 输出，输出量；产量；出产

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: outstanding
trans: adj. 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: overall
trans: adj. 全部的；全体的；一切在内的

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: overcome
trans: vt. 克服；胜过

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: overnight
trans: adv. 通宵；突然；昨晚

sentences.english: He became a millionaire overnight.
sentences.chinese: 他一夜之间就成了百万富翁。

detailed_translations.english: suddenly or surprisingly quickly
happening during the night or for the night

name: overseas
trans: adv. 在海外，海外

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: owe
trans: vt. 欠；感激；应给予；应该把……归功于

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

name: ownership
trans: n. 所有权；物主身份

sentences.english: The price of home ownership is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 房价在不断上涨。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of owning something

name: oxygen
trans: n. [化学] 氧气，[化学] 氧

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: pace
trans: n. 一步；步速；步伐；速度

sentences.english: He quickened his pace , longing to be home.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，盼望着早点回到家中。

sentences.english: Traffic slowed to a walking pace.
sentences.chinese: 车流速度减缓，犹如步行。

sentences.english: I found Mark at the hospital, pacing restlessly up and down.
sentences.chinese: 我看见马克在医院里焦躁不安地踱来踱去。

detailed_translations.english: the speed at which someone walks, runs, or moves
to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous

name: package
trans: n. 包，包裹；套装软件，[计] 程序包

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

name: packet
trans: n. 数据包，信息包；小包，小捆

sentences.english: Paul tore open the packet as soon as it arrived.
sentences.chinese: 保罗一收到包裹就拆开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数据包，信息包；小包，小捆
detailed_translations.english: a small flat package that is sent by post or delivered to someone

name: palm
trans: n. 手掌；棕榈树；掌状物

sentences.english: He held the pebble in the palm of his hand .
sentences.chinese: 他把那颗卵石握在手心里。

detailed_translations.english: the inside surface of your hand, in which you hold things

name: panel
trans: n. 仪表板；嵌板；座谈小组，全体陪审员

sentences.english: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

sentences.english: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
sentences.chinese: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

name: panic
trans: n. 恐慌，惊慌；大恐慌

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: parade
trans: n. 游行；阅兵；炫耀；行进；阅兵场

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.english: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

detailed_translations.english: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

name: parallel
trans: n. 平行线；对比

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

name: parliament
trans: n. 议会，国会

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

name: participant
trans: n. 参与者；关系者

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

name: participation
trans: n. 参与；分享；参股

sentences.english: Thank you for your participation.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的参与。

sentences.english: entertainment with plenty of audience participation
sentences.chinese: 有许多观众参与的娱乐活动

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking part in an activity or event

name: partly
trans: adv. 部分地；在一定程度上

sentences.english: The poor weather was partly responsible for the crash.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好是造成坠机事故的部分原因。

sentences.english: The company’s problems are partly due to bad management.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司的问题部分是由于管理不善造成的。

sentences.english: It is partly because of her sick mother that she hasn’t taken the job abroad.
sentences.chinese: 她没有接受那份去国外的工作，部分原因是母亲病了。

sentences.english: The group is funded partly by the government.
sentences.chinese: 那个团体的部分资金由政府提供。

detailed_translations.english: to some degree, but not completely

name: partnership
trans: n. 合伙；[经管] 合伙企业；合作关系；合伙契约

sentences.english: It’s one of the most successful partnerships in the country.
sentences.chinese: 它是该国最成功的合伙企业之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合伙；[经管] 合伙企业；合作关系；合伙契约
detailed_translations.english: the state of being a partner in business

name: part-time
trans: adj. 兼职的；部分时间的

sentences.english: a part-time job
sentences.chinese: 兼职工作

sentences.english: women wishing to return to work on a part-time basis
sentences.chinese: 希望以兼职形式重返职场的女性

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a part-time job works for only part of each day or week

name: passage
trans: n. 一段（文章）；走廊；通路

sentences.english: My office is just along the passage.
sentences.chinese: 我的办公室就在过道旁边。

sentences.english: We walked down a narrow passage to the back of the building.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着一条狭窄的通道来到大楼的后面。

sentences.english: an underground passage
sentences.chinese: 地下通道

sentences.english: The bridge isn’t strong enough to allow the passage of heavy vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥不够坚固，无法让重型车辆通过。

detailed_translations.english: a way through something

name: passionate
trans: adj. 热情的；热烈的，激昂的；易怒的

sentences.english: He had a brief but passionate love affair with an older woman.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个比他年长的女子有过一段短暂而炽热的情史。

sentences.english: a very passionate young man
sentences.chinese: 一位感情热烈的年轻人

sentences.english: a passionate lover
sentences.chinese: 富有激情的爱人

sentences.english: a passionate kiss
sentences.chinese: 激情的一吻

detailed_translations.english: showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love

name: password
trans: n. 密码；口令

sentences.english: Enter your password, then click on the ‘proceed’ icon.
sentences.chinese: 键入密码，然后点击“继续”图标。

sentences.english: Give your user name and password.
sentences.chinese: 输入用户名和密码。

detailed_translations.english: a secret group of letters or numbers that you must type into a computer before you can use a system or program

name: patience
trans: n. 耐性，耐心；忍耐，容忍

sentences.english: He doesn't have the patience to wait.
sentences.chinese: 他没有耐心等。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to stay calm and accept a delay or sth annoying without complaining

name: patient
trans: n. 病人；患者

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: pause
trans: n. 暂停；间歇

sentences.english: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。

sentences.english: After a long pause , she went on.
sentences.chinese: 停了好一会儿，她才继续下去。

detailed_translations.english: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

name: peer
trans: vt. 封为贵族；与…同等

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: penalty
trans: n. 罚款，罚金；处罚

sentences.english: No littering. Penalty $500.
sentences.chinese: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。

sentences.english: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
sentences.chinese: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

sentences.english: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty (= be killed as a punishment ) .
sentences.chinese: 一旦定罪，他可能会被判处死刑。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: pension
trans: n. 退休金，抚恤金；津贴；膳宿费

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
to grant a pension to

name: perceive
trans: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: perception
trans: n. 知觉；[生理] 感觉；看法；洞察力；获取

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

name: permanent
trans: n. 烫发（等于permanent wave）

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: permanently
trans: adv. 永久地，长期不变地

name: permit
trans: n. 许可证，执照

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: perspective
trans: n. 观点；远景；透视图

sentences.english: the artist’s use of perspective
sentences.chinese: 那位画家对透视法的运用

sentences.english: a perspective of the whole valley
sentences.chinese: 山谷全景

sentences.english: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

detailed_translations.english: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture

name: phase
trans: n. 月相

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: philosophy
trans: n. 哲学；哲理；人生观

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

name: pick
trans: n. 选择；鹤嘴锄；挖；掩护

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: picture
trans: n. 照片，图画；影片；景色；化身

sentences.english: The room had several pictures on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 那个房间墙上有几幅画。

sentences.english: a book with pictures in it
sentences.chinese: 带插图的书

sentences.english: He asked her permission to paint her picture (= paint a picture of her ) .
sentences.chinese: 他请求她允许为她画像。

detailed_translations.english: shapes, lines etc painted or drawn on a surface, showing what someone or something looks like
to show someone or something in a photograph, painting, or drawing

name: pile
trans: n. 堆；大量；建筑群

sentences.english: He balanced the plate on the top of a pile of books.
sentences.chinese: 他把盘子在一摞书上放稳。

sentences.english: Ma stacked the cups and piled the plates.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈把杯盘堆叠起来。

detailed_translations.english: a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each other
to arrange things in a pile

name: pill
trans: n. 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药

sentences.english: He has to take pills to control his blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 他必须服药控制血压。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sleeping pills"]}
sentences.chinese: 安眠药

sentences.english: a bottle of vitamin pills
sentences.chinese: 一瓶维生素片

detailed_translations.chinese: 药丸；弹丸，子弹；口服避孕药
detailed_translations.english: a small solid piece of medicine that you swallow whole

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…制成丸剂；使服用药丸；抢劫，掠夺（古语）

name: pitch
trans: n. 沥青；音高；程度；树脂；倾斜；投掷；球场

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点
detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

name: pity
trans: n. 怜悯，同情；遗憾

sentences.english: It’s a great pity Joyce wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯没有受到邀请太遗憾了。

sentences.english: I like Charlie. Pity he had to marry that awful woman.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢查利，遗憾的是他得和那个糟糕的女人结婚。

sentences.english: A pity we can’t find the guy who did it.
sentences.chinese: 真遗憾我们找不到那个干了这件事的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are disappointed about something and you wish things could happen differently

detailed_translations.chinese: 对……表示怜悯；对……感到同情
detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation

name: placement
trans: n. 布置；定位球；人员配置

name: plain
trans: n. 平原；无格式；朴实无华的东西

sentences.english: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
sentences.chinese: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。

sentences.english: the vast plains of central China
sentences.chinese: 华中地区的广阔平原

sentences.english: The advantages were plain to see.
sentences.chinese: 优势显而易见。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat dry land
very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

name: plot
trans: n. 情节；图；阴谋

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: plus
trans: prep. 加，加上

sentences.english: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
sentences.chinese: 3 加6等于9。

sentences.english: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
sentences.chinese: 全部费用是1万美元，外加14%的利息。

sentences.english: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
sentences.chinese: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or amount is added to another
more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures

name: pointed
trans: v. 指出；瞄准（point的过去式）

sentences.english: a pointed beard
sentences.chinese: 一把山羊胡

detailed_translations.english: having a point at the end

name: popularity
trans: n. 普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: portion
trans: n. 部分；一份；命运

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: pose
trans: vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: position
trans: n. 位置，方位；职位，工作；姿态；站位

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

name: positive
trans: n. 正数；[摄] 正片

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: possess
trans: vt. 控制；使掌握；持有；迷住；拥有，具备

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: potential
trans: n. 潜能；可能性；[电] 电势

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: potentially
trans: adv. 可能地，潜在地

sentences.english: a potentially dangerous situation
sentences.chinese: 有潜在危险的局势

detailed_translations.english: something that is potentially dangerous, useful etc is not dangerous etc now, but may become so in the future

name: power
trans: n. 力量，能力；电力，功率；政权，势力；[数] 幂

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: praise
trans: n. 赞扬；称赞；荣耀；崇拜

sentences.english: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。

sentences.english: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。

sentences.english: His first novel received high praise .
sentences.chinese: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。

sentences.english: Gregory was singled out (= he was chosen in particular ) for special praise .
sentences.chinese: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。

sentences.english: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

sentences.english: Jane was praised by her teacher.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：简受到了老师的表扬。

detailed_translations.english: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly

name: precede
trans: vt. 领先，在…之前；优于，高于

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

name: precious
trans: adj. 宝贵的；珍贵的；矫揉造作的

sentences.english: planes delivering precious supplies of medicine and food
sentences.chinese: 运送药品、食品等宝贵物资的飞机

sentences.english: our planet’s precious resources
sentences.chinese: 我们星球上的宝贵资源

detailed_translations.english: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

name: precise
trans: adj. 精确的；明确的；严格的

sentences.english: precise sales figures
sentences.chinese: 准确的销售数据

sentences.english: It was difficult to get precise information.
sentences.chinese: 很难得到确切的消息。

sentences.english: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
sentences.chinese: “她比你大很多，是不是？”“准确地说，大了15岁。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 精确的， 准确的； 严谨的
detailed_translations.english: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: precisely
trans: adv. 精确地；恰恰

sentences.english: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。

sentences.english: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
sentences.chinese: 她正是我们要找的那种人。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct

name: predictable
trans: adj. 可预言的

sentences.english: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。

sentences.english: an entertaining but predictable film
sentences.chinese: 一部有趣但老套的电影

sentences.english: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
sentences.chinese: 洛根的反应可想而知。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱，倾向；优先权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: pregnant
trans: adj. 怀孕的；富有意义的

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: preparation
trans: n. 预备；准备

sentences.english: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜适合宴会，因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

sentences.english: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
sentences.chinese: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。

sentences.english: a course in food service and food preparation
sentences.chinese: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

detailed_translations.english: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

name: presence
trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: preserve
trans: n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: price
trans: n. 价格；价值；代价

sentences.english: The price of fuel keeps going up.
sentences.chinese: 燃料价格持续上涨。

sentences.english: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
sentences.chinese: 为了短短几年的辉煌，他们也许要付出高昂的代价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money you have to pay for something

name: pride
trans: n. 自豪；骄傲；自尊心

sentences.english: He wore his medals with pride.
sentences.chinese: 他自豪地戴着奖章。

sentences.english: The people have a sense of pride in their community.
sentences.chinese: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。

sentences.english: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
sentences.chinese: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。

sentences.english: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。

sentences.english: Success in sport is a source of national pride .
sentences.chinese: 体育方面的成就可以激发民族自豪感。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

name: primarily
trans: adv. 首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: prime
trans: n. 初期；青年；精华；全盛时期

sentences.english: Smoking is the prime cause of lung disease.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是引发肺部疾病的首要原因。

sentences.english: Our prime concern is providing jobs for all young school leavers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是为所有的年轻毕业生提供工作。

sentences.english: He was named as the prime suspect in the murder investigation.
sentences.chinese: 在那宗谋杀案的调查中他被定为主要嫌疑人。

sentences.english: Good management is of prime importance in business.
sentences.chinese: 良好的经营管理在商业领域尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: most important
the time in your life when you are strongest and most active
to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

name: principal
trans: adj. 主要的；资本的

sentences.english: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
sentences.chinese: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。

sentences.english: Teaching is her principal source of income.
sentences.chinese: 教书是她主要的收入来源。

sentences.english: the principal character in the book
sentences.chinese: 书里的主人公

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 负责人， 校长； 资本， 本金； 主要演员， 主角
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: principle
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: print
trans: n. 印刷业；印花布；印刷字体；印章；印记

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: prior
trans: adj. 优先的；在先的，在前的

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: priority
trans: n. 优先；优先权；[数] 优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

name: privacy
trans: n. 隐私；秘密；隐居；隐居处

detailed_translations.english: the state of being free from public attention

trans: n. 程序，手续；步骤

sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

sentences.chinese: 夏季奥运会期间有数百个小时的电视节目对其进行报道。

trans: n. 进步，发展；前进

sentences.chinese: 进步的政府

sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

trans: n. 工程；计划；事业

sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager

sentences.english: a geography project

name: promising

sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start

name: promotion

sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

trans: vi. 建议；求婚；打算

sentences.chinese: 环境保护

sentences.chinese: 临床心理学家

sentences.chinese: …政府的宣传活动。

sentences.chinese: 大约20名小学生在这里学习音乐。

sentences.chinese: 教职员工和学生

sentences.chinese: 一名优秀的小学生

sentences.english: a third-grade pupil
sentences.chinese: 一名三年级小学生

sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

sentences.chinese: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。

sentences.chinese: 种族歧视的受害者

sentences.chinese: 需保护社区里的这一部分人，使其免受种族偏见的伤害。

sentences.english: evidence of racial harassment
sentences.chinese: 种族骚扰的证据

sentences.english: the campaign for racial equality
sentences.chinese: 争取种族平等的运动

sentences.english: the need for tolerance and racial harmony
sentences.chinese: 包容与种族融洽的必要性

detailed_translations.english: relating to the relationships between different races of people who now live in the same country or area

name: racism
trans: n. 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见

sentences.chinese: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。

sentences.english: the problem of racism in schools
sentences.chinese: 学校里的种族歧视问题

name: racist
trans: n. 种族主义者

sentences.english: He denied being a racist.
sentences.chinese: 他否认自己是种族主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that people of their own race are better than others, and who treats people from other races unfairly and sometimes violently – used to show disapproval

name: radiation

sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

name: rail
