sentences.chinese: 美国铁路系统

sentences.english: a high-speed rail network
sentences.chinese: 一个高速铁路网络

sentences.english: Passengers want a better rail service .
sentences.chinese: 乘客希望有更好的铁路服务。

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel and its rail links with London
sentences.chinese: 英吉利海峡隧道及其与伦敦之间的铁路连接

sentences.english: I need to buy a rail ticket .
sentences.chinese: 我要买一张火车票。

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票价

detailed_translations.english: to complain angrily about something, especially something that you think is very unfair

detailed_translations.chinese: 栏杆，横杆；铁轨，轨道；铁路
detailed_translations.english: the railway system

name: random
trans: n. 随意

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

name: range
trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉

sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

trans: n. 急流；高速交通工具，高速交通网

sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: rapidly
trans: adv. 迅速地；很快地；立即

sentences.english: The disease was spreading more rapidly than expected.
sentences.chinese: 疾病的蔓延比预期的要快。

detailed_translations.english: very quickly and in a very short time

name: rat
trans: n. 鼠；卑鄙小人，叛徒

sentences.english: This was demonstrated in a laboratory experiment with rats.
sentences.chinese: 这点通过在实验室中用老鼠做试验得到证明。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail

name: rate
trans: n. 比率，率；速度；价格；等级

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: rating
trans: n. 等级；等级评定；额定功率

sentences.english: By the end of the year the Prime Minister’s approval rating (= how many people agreed with his policies ) had fallen as low as 12 percent.
sentences.chinese: 到年底时，首相的支持率跌到了12%的低点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等级；等级评定；额定功率
detailed_translations.english: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, popular etc someone or something is

name: raw
trans: n. 擦伤处

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: grated raw carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的生胡萝卜

sentences.english: Cabbage can be eaten raw.
sentences.chinese: 洋白菜可以生吃。

sentences.english: raw sugar
sentences.chinese: 原糖

detailed_translations.english: not cooked

name: reach
trans: n. 范围；延伸；河段；横风行驶

sentences.english: We reached London late at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.english: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

detailed_translations.english: to arrive at a place

name: realistic
trans: adj. 现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: reasonable
trans: adj. 合理的，公道的；通情达理的

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

name: reasonably
trans: adv. 合理地；相当地；适度地

sentences.english: He can’t reasonably be expected to have known that.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，他是不可能知道那件事的。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is right or fair

name: rebuild
trans: vt. 重建；改造，重新组装；复原

sentences.english: The church was completely rebuilt in the last century.
sentences.chinese: 这座教堂在上个世纪全面重建。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重建；改造，重新组装；复原
detailed_translations.english: to build something again, after it has been damaged or destroyed

name: recall
trans: n. 召回；回忆；撤消

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: receiver
trans: n. 接收器；接受者；收信机；收款员，接待者

sentences.english: a satellite receiver
sentences.chinese: 卫星信号接收器

sentences.english: She picked up the receiver and dialled his number.
sentences.chinese: 她拿起听筒，拨了他的电话号码。

sentences.english: The business is in the hands of the receivers .
sentences.chinese: 公司现在由破产管理人接管。

detailed_translations.chinese: 电话听筒；接收器；〔破产企业或公司的〕管理人，接管人
detailed_translations.english: the part of a telephone that you hold next to your mouth and ear

name: recession
trans: n. 衰退；不景气；后退；凹处

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

name: reckon
trans: vi. 估计；计算；猜想，料想

sentences.english: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.chinese: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

detailed_translations.english: spoken to think or suppose something

name: recognition
trans: n. 识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: recover
trans: n. 还原至预备姿势

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: recovery
trans: n. 恢复，复原；痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: recruit
trans: n. 招聘；新兵；新成员

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: recruitment
trans: n. 补充；征募新兵

sentences.english: ...the examination system for the recruitment of civil servants.
sentences.chinese: …公务员招聘的考试体系。

detailed_translations.english: The recruitment of workers, soldiers, or members is the act or process of selecting them for an organization or army and persuading them to join

name: reduction
trans: n. 减少；下降；缩小；还原反应

sentences.english: strategies for noise reduction
sentences.chinese: 减少噪音的对策

sentences.english: The company promised they would make no staff reductions for at least two years.
sentences.chinese: 公司承诺至少两年不裁员。

detailed_translations.english: a decrease in the size, price, or amount of something, or the act of decreasing something

name: referee
trans: n. 裁判员；调解人；介绍人

sentences.english: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

name: refugee
trans: n. 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者

sentences.english: Refugees were streaming across the border.
sentences.chinese: 难民正涌过边境。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["refugee camps"]}
sentences.chinese: 难民营

detailed_translations.chinese: 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

name: regard
trans: n. 注意；尊重；问候；凝视

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: regional
trans: adj. 地区的；局部的；整个地区的

sentences.english: local and regional government
sentences.chinese: 地方及区域治理

sentences.english: regional variations in farming practice
sentences.chinese: 农耕方式的地区性差异

sentences.english: a slight regional accent
sentences.chinese: 轻微的地方口音

detailed_translations.chinese: 地区的；局部的；整个地区的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular region or area

name: register
trans: n. 登记；注册；记录；寄存器；登记簿

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: registration
trans: n. 登记；注册；挂号

sentences.english: Student registration (= for a course of study ) starts the first week in September.
sentences.chinese: 学生注册在9月份的第一个星期开始。

sentences.english: The registration fee is $75.
sentences.chinese: 注册费是75美元。

detailed_translations.english: the act of recording names and details on an official list

name: regret
trans: n. 遗憾；抱歉；悲叹

sentences.english: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.english: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened

name: regulate
trans: vt. 调节，规定；控制；校准；有系统的管理

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: regulation
trans: n. 管理；规则；校准

sentences.english: There seem to be so many rules and regulations these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像条条框框很多。

sentences.english: regulations governing the safety of toys
sentences.chinese: 监控玩具安全的条例

sentences.english: All companies must comply with the regulations .
sentences.chinese: 所有公司都必须遵守规定。

detailed_translations.english: an official rule or order

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: relatively
trans: adv. 相当地；相对地，比较地

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: relevant
trans: adj. 相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: relief
trans: n. 救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: relieve
trans: vt. 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: rely
trans: vi. 依靠；信赖

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: remark
trans: n. 注意；言辞

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: remarkably
trans: adv. 显著地；非常地；引人注目地

sentences.english: Remarkably, all of the passengers survived the crash.
sentences.chinese: 令人称奇的是，这次事故中所有乘客都幸免于难。

name: reporting
trans: n. 报告；报导

name: representative
trans: n. 代表；典型；众议员

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

name: reputation
trans: n. 名声，名誉；声望

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: requirement
trans: n. 要求；必要条件；必需品

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: rescue
trans: n. 营救；援救；解救

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: reserve
trans: n. 储备，储存；自然保护区；预备队；缄默；[金融] 储备金

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: resident
trans: n. 居民；住院医生

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: resign
trans: n. 辞去职务

sentences.english: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.
sentences.chinese: 一位医院主管因为有人声称他的职位是骗来的而辞职了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization
to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

name: resist
trans: n. [助剂] 抗蚀剂；防染剂

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: resolution
trans: n. [物] 分辨率；决议；解决；决心

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: resolve
trans: n. 坚决；决定要做的事

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: resort
trans: n. 凭借，手段；度假胜地；常去之地

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

name: restore
trans: vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: restrict
trans: vt. 限制；约束；限定

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: restriction
trans: n. 限制；约束；束缚

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: retail
trans: n. 零售

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: retain
trans: vt. 保持；雇；记住

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: retirement
trans: n. 退休，退役

sentences.english: She took early retirement (= retired at an earlier age than usual ) last year.
sentences.chinese: 她去年提前退休了。

sentences.english: Dad’s approaching retirement age .
sentences.chinese: 爸爸快到退休年龄了。

detailed_translations.english: when you stop working, usually because of your age

name: reveal
trans: n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: revenue
trans: n. 税收，国家的收入；收益

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: revision
trans: n. [印刷] 修正；复习；修订本

sentences.english: I know I haven’t done enough revision for tomorrow’s exam.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我对明天的考试准备不足。

detailed_translations.english: the process of changing something in order to improve it by correcting it or including new information or ideas

name: revolution
trans: n. 革命；旋转；运行；循环

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: reward
trans: n. [劳经] 报酬；报答；酬谢

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: rhythm
trans: n. 节奏；韵律

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

name: rid
trans: vt. 使摆脱；使去掉

sentences.english: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
sentences.chinese: 销毁本国核武器的承诺

detailed_translations.english: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it

name: ridiculous
trans: adj. 可笑的；荒谬的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: risky
trans: adj. 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的

sentences.english: Doctors say it’s too risky to try and operate.
sentences.chinese: 医生说动手术风险太大。

sentences.english: Buying a secondhand car is a risky business .
sentences.chinese: 买二手汽车是有风险的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 危险的；冒险的；（作品等）有伤风化的
detailed_translations.english: involving a risk that something bad will happen

name: rival
trans: n. 对手；竞争者

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: rob
trans: vt. 抢劫；使…丧失；非法剥夺

sentences.english: They killed four policemen while robbing a bank.
sentences.chinese: 他们抢劫一家银行的时候杀了4名警察。

sentences.english: A 77-year-old woman was robbed at knifepoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名77岁老妪遭到持刀抢劫。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money or property from a person, bank etc

name: robbery
trans: n. 抢劫，盗窃；抢掠

sentences.english: Police are investigating a series of bank robberies in South Wales.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查发生在南威尔士的连环银行抢劫案。

sentences.english: He received a 10 year prison sentence for armed robbery (= robbery using a gun ) .
sentences.chinese: 他因持枪抢劫被判十年监禁。

sentences.english: He admitted attempted robbery and was given a suspended sentence.
sentences.chinese: 他承认企图行劫，被判了缓刑。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of stealing money or things from a bank, shop etc, especially using violence

name: rocket
trans: n. 火箭

sentences.english: The rocket was launched from a space research base.
sentences.chinese: 火箭从一个太空研究基地发射升空。

sentences.english: a space rocket
sentences.chinese: 航天火箭

sentences.english: Interest rates rocketed up.
sentences.chinese: 利率飞涨。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle used for travelling or carrying things into space, which is shaped like a big tube
if a price or amount rockets, it increases quickly and suddenly

name: romance
trans: n. 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事

sentences.english: Michelle married him after a whirlwind romance (= one that happens very suddenly and quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 经过一场旋风式的恋爱，米歇尔嫁给了他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 传奇；浪漫史；风流韵事；冒险故事
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and often short relationship between two people who love each other
to describe things that have happened in a way that makes them seem more important, interesting etc than they really were

name: root
trans: n. 根；根源；词根；祖先

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

name: rose
trans: n. 玫瑰；粉红色；蔷薇（花）；粉红色的葡萄酒

sentences.english: a dozen red roses
sentences.chinese: 一打红玫瑰

sentences.english: A large bouquet of roses arrived on her desk.
sentences.chinese: 一大束玫瑰送到了她的桌子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玫瑰；粉红色；蔷薇（花）；粉红色的葡萄酒
detailed_translations.english: a flower that often has a pleasant smell, and is usually red, pink, white, or yellow, or the bush that this flower grows on

detailed_translations.chinese: 玫瑰花的；玫瑰色的；粉红色的；带有玫瑰香味的
detailed_translations.english: pink in colour

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成玫瑰色，使（面颊）发红；使有玫瑰香味
detailed_translations.english: to make rose-coloured; cause to blush or redden

detailed_translations.chinese: 起义( rise的过去式)；升起；（数量）增加；休会

name: roughly
trans: adv. 粗糙地；概略地

sentences.english: There were roughly 200 people there.
sentences.chinese: 那儿大约有200人。

sentences.english: Azaleas flower at roughly the same time each year.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃花每年的开花时间大致相同。

detailed_translations.english: not exactly

name: round
trans: n. 圆；循环；一回合；圆形物

sentences.english: We sat round the table playing cards.
sentences.chinese: 我们围桌而坐玩纸牌。

sentences.english: Gather round! I have an important announcement to make.
sentences.chinese: 大家围拢来！我有重要事情要宣布。

sentences.english: He put his arm gently round her waist.
sentences.chinese: 他轻轻地搂着她的腰。

sentences.english: I kept the key on a chain round my neck.
sentences.chinese: 我给钥匙穿了根链子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: The ballroom’s huge, with windows all the way round .
sentences.chinese: 舞厅很大，四周都是窗户。

sentences.english: There was a lovely courtyard with tables all round .
sentences.chinese: 有一个漂亮的庭院，四周都是桌子。

detailed_translations.english: surrounding or on all sides of something or someone
shaped like a circle
a round of events is a series of related events, which are part of a longer process
on the other side of something, or to the other side of it without going through it or over it

name: routine
trans: n. [计] 程序；日常工作；例行公事

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: rub
trans: n. 摩擦；障碍；磨损处

sentences.english: You’ll have to rub harder if you want to get it clean.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想把它弄干净，就得更使劲地擦。

sentences.english: I hurriedly rubbed myself dry.
sentences.chinese: 我赶紧把自己擦干。

detailed_translations.english: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

name: rubber
trans: n. 橡胶；橡皮；合成橡胶；按摩师

sentences.english: a rubber ball
sentences.chinese: 橡皮球

detailed_translations.chinese: 橡胶；橡皮；合成橡胶；按摩师
detailed_translations.english: a substance used to make tyres, boots etc, which is made from the juice of a tropical tree or artificially

name: ruin
trans: n. 废墟；毁坏；灭亡

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

name: rural
trans: adj. 农村的，乡下的；田园的，有乡村风味的

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: rush
trans: n. 冲进；匆促；急流；灯心草

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

name: sample
trans: n. 样品；样本；例子

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

detailed_translations.chinese: 从…抽样； 品尝， 体验
detailed_translations.english: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like

name: satellite
trans: n. 卫星；人造卫星；随从；卫星国家

sentences.english: the launch of a communications and weather satellite
sentences.chinese: 气象通信卫星的发射

detailed_translations.english: a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication

name: satisfaction
trans: n. 满意，满足；赔偿；乐事；赎罪

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

name: satisfied
trans: v. 使满意（satisfy的过去式）

sentences.english: a satisfied smile
sentences.chinese: 满意的微笑

sentences.english: They have plenty of satisfied customers .
sentences.chinese: 他们的许多客户都很满意。

sentences.english: Will she ever be satisfied?
sentences.chinese: 她何时才能满足？

detailed_translations.english: feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want

name: satisfy
trans: vi. 令人满意；令人满足

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

name: saving
trans: n. 节约；挽救；存款

sentences.english: Buying a house had taken all their savings.
sentences.chinese: 买房子花掉了他们所有的积蓄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节省， 节约； 储蓄金， 存款
detailed_translations.english: all the money that you have saved, especially in a bank

name: scale
trans: n. 规模；比例；鳞；刻度；天平；数值范围

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: scandal
trans: n. 丑闻；流言蜚语；诽谤；公愤

sentences.english: It caused quite a scandal when he left his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他离开妻子成了一大丑闻。

sentences.english: The college has recently been involved in a drugs scandal .
sentences.chinese: 这所大学最近卷入了毒品丑闻。

sentences.english: He has been at the centre of a political scandal .
sentences.chinese: 他成了一桩政治丑闻的焦点。

sentences.english: a major scandal involving the government
sentences.chinese: 涉及政府的一桩重大丑闻

sentences.english: a series of financial scandals
sentences.chinese: 一连串金融丑闻

sentences.english: a sex scandal that ruined his reputation
sentences.chinese: 让他名誉扫地的性丑闻

sentences.english: They had already left the country when the scandal broke .
sentences.chinese: 丑闻爆出时他们已经离开了这个国家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丑事， 丑闻； 流言蜚语； 反感， 愤慨
detailed_translations.english: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people

name: scare
trans: n. 恐慌；惊吓；惊恐

sentences.english: You really gave us a scare !
sentences.chinese: 你真的吓了我们一跳！

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling of fear

name: scenario
trans: n. 方案；情节；剧本；设想

sentences.english: The conflict degenerating into civil war is everybody's nightmare scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这场冲突恶化成内战成为每个人的恶梦。

detailed_translations.english: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

name: schedule
trans: n. 时间表；计划表；一览表

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: scheme
trans: n. 计划；组合；体制；诡计

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: scholar
trans: n. 学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

name: scholarship
trans: n. 奖学金；学识，学问

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

name: scratch
trans: n. 擦伤；抓痕；刮擦声；乱写

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

name: scream
trans: n. 尖叫声；尖锐刺耳的声音；极其滑稽可笑的人

sentences.english: After the first few shots, people started screaming.
sentences.chinese: 几声枪响过后，人们开始尖叫起来。

sentences.english: a screaming baby
sentences.chinese: 尖声哭叫的婴儿

sentences.english: The children were screaming with laughter .
sentences.chinese: 小孩子们在尖声欢笑。

sentences.english: She was screaming her head off (= screaming a lot ) .
sentences.chinese: 她不停地尖叫。

sentences.english: She began to scream blue murder (= scream very loudly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她开始高声尖叫。

sentences.english: He was dragged kicking and screaming to a nearby van.
sentences.chinese: 他又踢又叫着被拖到附近的一辆小货车上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫；呼啸；发出尖锐刺耳的声音；令人触目惊心
detailed_translations.english: to make a loud high noise with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫声；尖锐刺耳的声音；极其滑稽可笑的人
detailed_translations.english: a loud high sound that you make with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

name: screen
trans: n. 屏，幕；屏风

sentences.english: a computer with an 18-inch colour screen
sentences.chinese: 带18英寸彩色屏幕的电脑

sentences.english: He went on staring at the TV screen .
sentences.chinese: 他继续盯着电视屏幕看。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a television or computer where the picture or information appears

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩蔽， 遮蔽； 放映， 播放； 审查， 甄别
detailed_translations.english: if something screens something else, it is in front of it and hides it

name: screening
trans: n. 筛选；放映；[物] 屏蔽；审查；防波

sentences.english: a screening of Spielberg’s new movie
sentences.chinese: 斯皮尔伯格的新片放映

sentences.english: Most of the road behind the hotel was screened by an apartment block.
sentences.chinese: 旅馆后面那条路的大部分都被一排公寓楼挡住了。

detailed_translations.english: the showing of a film or television programme
If something is screened by another thing, it is behind it and hidden by it

name: seat
trans: n. 座位；所在地；职位

sentences.english: I was in the back seat and Jo was driving.
sentences.chinese: 我在后座，乔开车。

sentences.english: a 10,000-seat stadium
sentences.chinese: 万人体育场

sentences.english: People were shifting in their seats, looking uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 人们在座位上动来动去，看上去不大自在。

sentences.english: He waved toward a chair, and seated himself at the desk.
sentences.chinese: 他朝一把椅子一挥手，在桌旁坐了下来。

detailed_translations.english: a place where you can sit, especially one in a vehicle or one from which you watch a performance, sports event etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…坐下；可容纳…的；使就职
detailed_translations.english: If you seat yourself somewhere, you sit down

name: sector
trans: n. 部门；扇形，扇区；象限仪；函数尺

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

name: secure
trans: vt. 保护；弄到；招致；缚住

sentences.english: There are no secure jobs these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今已经没有铁饭碗了。

sentences.english: We want a secure future for our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望我们的孩子未来生活无虞。

sentences.english: United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
sentences.chinese: 联队在联赛中的头名位置似乎相对稳固。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost

name: seek
trans: vt. 寻求；寻找；探索；搜索

sentences.english: new graduates seeking employment
sentences.chinese: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
sentences.chinese: 驾车者被告知需另寻其他路线。

sentences.english: They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速设法远离抗议者。

detailed_translations.english: to look for someone or something

name: seeker
trans: n. 探求者；搜查人

sentences.english: I am a seeker after truth.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名真理的追求者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trying to find or get something

name: select
trans: n. 被挑选者；精萃

sentences.english: The party was small and select.
sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

name: selection
trans: n. 选择，挑选；选集；精选品

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

name: self
trans: n. 自己，自我；本质；私心

sentences.english: a child’s developing sense of self
sentences.chinese: 儿童逐渐形成的自我意识

detailed_translations.english: the type of person you are, your character, your typical behaviour etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 使自花授精；使近亲繁殖

name: seminar
trans: n. 讨论会，研讨班

sentences.english: a Shakespeare seminar
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚研讨班

detailed_translations.english: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

name: senior
trans: n. 上司；较年长者；毕业班学生

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

name: sense
trans: n. 感觉，功能；观念；道理；理智

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: sensitive
trans: adj. 敏感的；感觉的；[仪] 灵敏的；感光的；易受伤害的；易受影响的

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: sentence
trans: n. [语][计] 句子，命题；宣判，判决

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

name: sequence
trans: n. [数][计] 序列；顺序；续发事件

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: session
trans: n. 会议；（法庭的）开庭；（议会等的）开会；学期；讲习会

sentences.english: Board members met in closed session (= with nobody else present ) .
sentences.chinese: 委员会成员举行了闭门会议。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

name: settle
trans: n. 有背长椅

sentences.english: When the children had settled, Miss Brown gave out the new reading books.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们静下来后，布朗小姐给他们发新的故事书。

sentences.english: She breathed deeply to settle her nerves (= stop herself from feeling worried or frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 她深深地吸了口气平静自己的情绪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 安放； 调停； 支付， 核算； 安家； 飞落， 停留； 安定
detailed_translations.english: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm

name: settler
trans: n. 移居者；殖民者

sentences.english: early settlers in Australia
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的早期移民

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in a country or area where not many people like them have lived before, and that is a long way from any towns or cities

name: severe
trans: adj. 严峻的；严厉的；剧烈的；苛刻的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: severely
trans: adv. 严重地；严格地，严厉地；纯朴地

sentences.english: The town was severely damaged in the war.
sentences.chinese: 这座城镇在战争中遭到了严重破坏。

sentences.english: She’s now severely disabled.
sentences.chinese: 她现在是重度残疾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重地；严格地，严厉地；纯朴地
detailed_translations.english: very badly or to a great degree

name: sexy
trans: adj. 性感的；迷人的；色情的

sentences.english: sexy underwear
sentences.chinese: 性感内衣

sentences.english: Don’t you think he’s sexy?
sentences.chinese: 你不觉得他很性感吗？

detailed_translations.english: sexually exciting or sexually attractive

name: shade
trans: n. 树荫；阴影；阴凉处；遮阳物；（照片等的）明暗度；少量、些微；细微的差别

sentences.english: a delicate/pale/rich/soft shade of red
sentences.chinese: 淡 / 浅 / 艳 / 柔和的红色

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

name: shadow
trans: n. 阴影；影子；幽灵；庇护；隐蔽处

sentences.english: the long dark shadow of an old oak tree
sentences.chinese: 一棵老橡树长长的影子

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴影；影子；幽灵；庇护；隐蔽处
detailed_translations.english: the dark shape that someone or something makes on a surface when they are between that surface and the light
to follow someone closely in order to watch what they are doing
the group of politicians in the British parliament who would become ministers if their party was in government

name: shallow
trans: n. [地理] 浅滩

sentences.english: a shallow river
sentences.chinese: 浅河

sentences.english: The lake is quite shallow.
sentences.chinese: 这湖很浅。

sentences.english: the shallow end of the pool
sentences.chinese: 游泳池的浅水区

sentences.english: Place the meat in a shallow dish.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放在一个浅盘里。

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom

name: shame
trans: n. 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

name: shape
trans: n. 形状；模型；身材；具体化

sentences.english: What shape is the table?
sentences.chinese: 那张桌子是什么形状的？

sentences.english: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
sentences.chinese: 可以根据树叶的形状辨认出是什么树。

sentences.english: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
sentences.chinese: 他那顶破旧的帽子已经完全变形了。

sentences.english: The plants grow in every shape and size .
sentences.chinese: 这些植物有各种形状，各种大小。

sentences.english: The children cut out shapes (= squares, triangles etc ) from the piece of cardboard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把卡纸片剪成各种形状。

detailed_translations.english: the form that something has, for example round, square,  triangular  etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成；塑造，使成形；使符合
detailed_translations.english: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way

name: shaped
trans: adj. 合适的；成某种形状的；有计划的

name: shelter
trans: n. 庇护；避难所；遮盖物

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: shift
trans: n. 移动；变化；手段；轮班

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: ship
trans: n. 船；舰；太空船

sentences.english: We'll ship your order to the address we print on your cheques.
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你预订的货物送到我们印在你单据上的地址。

detailed_translations.english: to send goods somewhere by ship, plane, truck etc
a large boat used for carrying people or goods across the sea

name: shock
trans: n. 休克；震惊；震动；打击；禾束堆

sentences.english: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

name: shocked
trans: v. 使震动（shock的过去式）

sentences.english: We were too shocked to talk.
sentences.chinese: 我们愕然无语。

sentences.english: After forty years in the police force nothing much shocks me.
sentences.chinese: 在警察部门干了40年后，没有什么能令我非常震惊了。

detailed_translations.english: feeling surprised and upset by something very unexpected and unpleasant
If something shocks you, it makes you feel very upset, because it involves death or suffering and because you had not expected it

name: shocking
trans: adj. 令人震惊的；可怕的，令人厌恶的；糟糕的

name: shooting
trans: n. 射击；打猎；摄影；射门

sentences.english: the grouse shooting season
sentences.chinese: 松鸡狩猎季节

sentences.english: The shooting party set off shortly before dawn.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓前不久这群打猎者就出发了。

detailed_translations.english: the sport of shooting animals and birds with guns

name: shore
trans: n. 海滨；支柱

sentences.english: We could see a boat about a mile from shore.
sentences.chinese: 我们看见离岸边大约一英里的地方有一艘船。

sentences.english: Only a few survivors reached the shore.
sentences.chinese: 仅有几个生还者到达岸边。

sentences.english: She began to swim to shore.
sentences.chinese: 她开始朝岸边游去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支撑，使稳住；用支柱撑住
detailed_translations.english: to prop or make safe with or as if with a shore
the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake

name: shortage
trans: n. 缺乏，缺少；不足

sentences.english: There is no heating available due to fuel shortages.
sentences.chinese: 因为燃料短缺，所以没有供暖。

sentences.english: There is no shortage of funds.
sentences.chinese: 不缺资金。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need

name: shortly
trans: adv. 立刻；简短地；唐突地

sentences.english: Ms Jones will be back shortly.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯女士很快就会回来。

detailed_translations.english: soon

name: short-term
trans: adj. 短期的

sentences.english: The treatment may bring short-term benefits to AIDS sufferers.
sentences.chinese: 这种疗法对艾滋病患者可能会有短期效果。

sentences.english: Most of the staff are on short-term contracts.
sentences.chinese: 大部分职员签的都是短期合同。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from short-term memory loss.
sentences.chinese: 她患有短期失忆症。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a short time, or relating only to the period that is not very far into the future

name: shot
trans: n. 发射；炮弹；射手；镜头

sentences.english: In the opening shot, we see Travolta’s feet walking down the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 在开场的镜头中，我们看到特拉沃尔塔的脚在人行道上行走。

detailed_translations.english: the view of something in a film or television programme that is produced by having the camera in a particular position

detailed_translations.chinese: 用尽的；破旧的；杂色的，闪光的
detailed_translations.english: in bad condition because of being used too much or treated badly

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击（shoot的过去式和过去分词）

name: sibling
trans: n. 兄弟姊妹；民族成员

sentences.english: Most young smokers are influenced by their friends’ and older siblings’ smoking habits.
sentences.chinese: 大多数年轻的吸烟者都是因为他们的朋友或者哥哥姐姐有吸烟习惯而受影响的。

detailed_translations.english: a brother or sister

name: signature
trans: n. 署名；签名；信号

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: significance
trans: n. 意义；重要性；意思

sentences.english: a decision of major political significance
sentences.chinese: 具有重大政治意义的决定

detailed_translations.english: the importance of sth, especially when this has an effect on what happens in the future

name: significant
trans: n. 象征；有意义的事物

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: significantly
trans: adv. 显著地；相当数量地

sentences.english: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意味深长地，值得注目地
detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is very important

name: silence
trans: n. 沉默；寂静；缄默；不谈；无声状态

sentences.english: There was a brief silence before anyone answered.
sentences.chinese: 沉默了片刻才有人回答。

sentences.english: ‘Silence in court!’ roared the judge.
sentences.chinese: “法庭上请保持肃静！”法官吼道。

sentences.english: The accused exercised his right to silence (= the legal right to choose to say nothing ) .
sentences.chinese: 被告行使了沉默权。

sentences.english: She held up her hand to silence the children.
sentences.chinese: 她抬手示意孩子们安静下来。

detailed_translations.english: complete quiet because nobody is talking
