sentences.english: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。

sentences.english: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说，一边拼命忍住泪水。

sentences.english: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
sentences.chinese: 他亲了亲她的脸，这个举动让她热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。

sentences.english: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
sentences.chinese: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道，眼里噙满泪水。

sentences.english: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我已泪流满面。

sentences.english: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
sentences.chinese: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

detailed_translations.english: a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying

name: technological
trans: adj. 技术的；工艺的

sentences.english: The steam engine was the greatest technological advance of the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机是19世纪最伟大的技术进步。

detailed_translations.english: related to technology

name: teens
trans: n. 十多岁，十几岁；青少年

sentences.english: Most people who smoke began smoking in their teens.
sentences.chinese: 大多数吸烟的人都是在十几岁时开始吸的。

detailed_translations.english: If you are a teen in your teens, you are between thirteen and nineteen years old. Teen is informal for teenager.

name: temple
trans: n. 庙宇；寺院；神殿；太阳穴

sentences.english: They lighted the temple with many candles.
sentences.chinese: 他们用许多蜡烛照亮这个寺庙。

sentences.english: The entire valley reverberated with the sound of the temple bells.
sentences.chinese: 整个山谷回荡着庙宇的钟声。

sentences.english: After the fire, nothing remained of the magnificent buildings of the temple.
sentences.chinese: 大火过后， 寺院里的那些雄伟建筑已荡然无存。

detailed_translations.english: a building where people go to  worship  , in the Jewish, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Mormon religions

name: temporarily
trans: adv. 临时地，临时

sentences.english: You might only need it temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 可能你只是暂时的需要它。

sentences.english: Reparations were temporarily pretermitted.
sentences.chinese: 赔款暂时中止了。

sentences.english: He is temporarily acting for her in that post.
sentences.chinese: 他是暂时代理她的职务。

name: temporary
trans: n. 临时工，临时雇员

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: tendency
trans: n. 倾向，趋势；癖好

sentences.english: children with aggressive or anti-social tendencies
sentences.chinese: 具有攻击性倾向或反社会倾向的儿童

detailed_translations.chinese: 趋向， 趋势， 倾向
detailed_translations.english: if someone or something has a tendency to do or become a particular thing, they are likely to do or become it

name: tension
trans: n. 张力，拉力；紧张，不安；电压

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

name: term
trans: n. 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项

sentences.english: Teachers often feel overworked in term time (= during the term ) .
sentences.chinese: 教师在学期内经常觉得工作担子过重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 术语；学期；期限；条款；(代数式等的)项
detailed_translations.english: a word or expression with a particular meaning, especially one that is used for a specific subject or type of language
to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something

name: terminal
trans: n. 末端；终点；终端机；极限

sentences.english: a terminal branch of a tree
sentences.chinese: 树顶枝条

sentences.english: terminal examinations (= at the end of a course, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 期终考试

sentences.english: the airport’s passenger terminal
sentences.chinese: 机场航站楼

detailed_translations.english: at the end of sth

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔飞机、公共汽车、轮船客运或货物运输的〕集散站，终点站
detailed_translations.english: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded

name: terms
trans: n. 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式）

sentences.english: Myocardial infarction is the medical term for a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 心肌梗塞是心脏病发作的医学术语。

sentences.english: He had been termed a temporary employee.
sentences.chinese: 他曾被称为临时工。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地位，关系；[法] 条款；术语；措辞；价钱（term的复数形式）
detailed_translations.english: A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject
If you say that something is termed a particular thing, you mean that that is what people call it or that is their opinion of it

name: terribly
trans: adv. 非常；可怕地；极度地

sentences.english: I’m terribly sorry to have kept you waiting.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，让你久等了。

sentences.english: The coach was not terribly worried about his team’s poor performance.
sentences.chinese: 教练对他所执教球队的糟糕表现并不是十分担忧。

detailed_translations.english: very

name: terrify
trans: vt. 恐吓；使恐怖；使害怕

sentences.english: Her husband’s violence terrified her.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫的暴力行为让她感到害怕。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely afraid

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: terror
trans: n. 恐怖；恐怖行动；恐怖时期；可怕的人

sentences.english: There was a look of sheer terror (= complete terror ) on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme fear

name: terrorism
trans: n. 恐怖主义；恐怖行动；恐怖统治

sentences.english: The government is doing everything possible to combat terrorism .
sentences.chinese: 政府正在尽其所能打击恐怖主义。

sentences.english: a despicable act of terrorism
sentences.chinese: 恐怖主义的卑劣行径

sentences.english: their involvement in international terrorism
sentences.chinese: 他们参与国际恐怖主义活动

detailed_translations.english: the use of violence such as bombing, shooting, or  kidnapping  to obtain political demands such as making a government do something

name: terrorist
trans: n. 恐怖主义者，恐怖分子

sentences.english: We refuse to talk to terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 我们拒绝和恐怖分子对话。

sentences.english: a terrorist bomb that left 168 people dead
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子引爆造成168人死亡的炸弹

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses violence such as bombing, shooting etc to obtain political demands

name: testing
trans: n. [试验] 测试

name: textbook
trans: n. 教科书，课本

sentences.english: a biology textbook
sentences.chinese: 一本生物教科书

detailed_translations.english: a book that contains information about a subject that people study, especially at school or college

name: theft
trans: n. 盗窃；偷；赃物

sentences.english: There have been a number of thefts in the area.
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗偷窃案。

sentences.english: the theft of £150 from the office
sentences.chinese: 办公室150英镑失窃

detailed_translations.english: an act of stealing something

name: therapist
trans: n. 临床医学家；治疗学家

sentences.english: a speech therapist
sentences.chinese: 言语治疗师

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been trained to give a particular form of treatment for physical or mental illness

name: therapy
trans: n. 治疗，疗法

sentences.english: new drug therapies
sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
sentences.chinese: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

name: thesis
trans: n. 论文；论点

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

name: thorough
trans: adj. 彻底的；十分的；周密的

sentences.english: The doctor gave him a thorough check-up.
sentences.chinese: 医生给他做了一次全面的体检。

sentences.english: a thorough and detailed biography
sentences.chinese: 详尽的传记

sentences.english: The police investigation was very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 警方的调查十分彻底。

sentences.english: thorough notes of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 详尽的会议记录

detailed_translations.english: including every possible detail

name: thoroughly
trans: adv. 彻底地，完全地

sentences.english: The room had been thoroughly cleaned.
sentences.chinese: 房间彻底打扫过了。

detailed_translations.english: carefully, so that nothing is forgotten

name: threat
trans: n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: threaten
trans: vt. 威胁；恐吓；预示

sentences.english: Postal workers are threatening a strike if they don’t receive a pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 邮政工人威胁如果不加薪，他们就要罢工。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: thumb
trans: n. 拇指

sentences.english: I thumbed a lift into town.
sentences.chinese: 我拦顺路车进了城。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade a driver of a passing car to stop and take you somewhere, by putting your hand out with your thumb raised
the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things

name: thus
trans: conj. 因此

sentences.english: Most of the evidence was destroyed in the fire. Thus it would be almost impossible to prove him guilty.
sentences.chinese: 大多数证据已在大火中烧毁，因而要证明他有罪几乎是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that you have just mentioned

name: time
trans: n. 时间；时代；次数；节拍；倍数

sentences.english: Einstein changed the way we think about space and time.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦改变了我们的时空概念。

sentences.english: close relationships established over a long period of time
sentences.chinese: 长期建立起来的亲密关系

sentences.english: Customers have only a limited amount of time to examine the goods.
sentences.chinese: 顾客只有有限的时间可以检查商品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 时间；时代；次数；节拍；倍数
detailed_translations.english: the thing that is measured in minutes, hours, days, years etc using clocks

detailed_translations.chinese: 计时；测定…的时间；安排…的速度
detailed_translations.english: to arrange that something should happen at a particular time

name: timing
trans: n. 定时；调速；时间选择

name: tissue
trans: n. 组织；纸巾；薄纱；一套

sentences.english: ...a small package wrapped in tissue paper.
sentences.chinese: …一个小包裹，用薄棉纸包着。

sentences.english: As we age we lose muscle tissue.
sentences.chinese: 随着年纪的增大，我们会失去一些肌肉组织。

detailed_translations.english: light thin paper used for wrapping, packing etc

name: title
trans: n. 冠军；标题；头衔；权利；字幕

sentences.english: "Patience and Sarah" was first published in 1969 under the title "A Place for Us."
sentences.chinese: 《耐心与萨拉》于1969年以《我们的地方》为书名首次出版。

sentences.english: Pirandello titled his play "Six Characters in Search of an Author."
sentences.chinese: 皮兰德娄将其戏剧命名为《六个寻找作者的剧中人》。

sentences.english: The single is titled "White Love."
sentences.chinese: 这支单曲名为《白色之恋》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冠军；标题；头衔；权利；字幕
detailed_translations.english: the name given to a particular book, painting, play etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 加标题于；赋予头衔；把…称为
detailed_translations.english: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a name

name: ton
trans: n. 吨；很多，大量

sentences.english: I’ve got tons of work to do.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多工作要做。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 2,240 pounds or 1,016 kilograms in Britain, and 2,000 pounds or 907.2 kilograms in the US

name: tone
trans: n. 语气；色调；音调；音色

sentences.english: Her tone was sharp with anger.
sentences.chinese: 她很气愤，语气尖刻。

sentences.english: It was obvious from her tone of voice that she didn’t like me.
sentences.chinese: 从她的语气明显听得出来她不喜欢我。

detailed_translations.english: the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean

name: tonne
trans: n. [计量] 公吨（1，000公斤，等于metric ton）

name: tough
trans: n. 恶棍

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: tournament
trans: n. 锦标赛，联赛；比赛

sentences.english: She is aching to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.english: They dropped two games in a row and were eliminated from the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.english: It's no use egging him on; he's made up his mind not to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: trace
trans: n. 痕迹，踪迹；微量；[仪] 迹线；缰绳

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: track
trans: n. 轨道；足迹，踪迹；小道

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: trading
trans: n. 交易；贸易；购物

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲剧；灾难；惨案

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: tragic
trans: adj. 悲剧的；悲痛的，不幸的

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: trait
trans: n. 特性，特点；品质；少许

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: transfer
trans: n. 转让；转移；传递；过户

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: transform
trans: vt. 改变，使…变形；转换

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡；转变；[分子生物] 转换；变调

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: transmit
trans: vt. 传输；传播；发射；传达；遗传

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: transportation
trans: n. 运输；运输系统；运输工具；流放

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: trap
trans: n. 陷阱；圈套；[建] 存水湾

sentences.english: Mr Smith has walked straight into a trap laid by the Tories.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生直接落入了保守党布设的圈套。

sentences.english: He felt he had been trapped into accepting the terms of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得自己是中了圈套才接受这合同条款的。

sentences.english: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.chinese: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

detailed_translations.english: a clever trick that is used to catch someone or to make them do or say something that they did not intend to
to trick sb into sth

name: treasure
trans: n. 财富，财产；财宝；珍品

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery
to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you

name: trial
trans: n. 试验；审讯；努力；磨炼

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: tribe
trans: n. 部落；族；宗族；一伙

sentences.english: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
sentences.chinese: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

detailed_translations.english: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

name: trigger
trans: n. 扳机；[电子] 触发器；制滑机

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: trillion
trans: num. [数] 万亿

sentences.english: In a short time the number of cells is more than a trillion.
sentences.chinese: 不久细胞的数量就超过了一万亿。

sentences.english: Japan’s exports were worth $43 trillion last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年日本的出口商品价值43万亿美元。

name: trip
trans: n. 旅行；绊倒；差错

sentences.english: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
sentences.chinese: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

sentences.english: It’s an 80-mile round trip (= a journey to a place and back again ) to Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

sentences.english: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip (= a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose ) . Mr Burgess has already left.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你是白来一趟了，伯吉斯先生已经走了。

sentences.english: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
sentences.chinese: 他无法前去领奖。

detailed_translations.english: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose
to hit something with your foot by accident so that you fall or almost fall

name: troop
trans: vt. 把（骑兵）编成骑兵连

sentences.english: Both countries agreed to withdraw their troops .
sentences.chinese: 两国都同意撤军。

sentences.english: troops stationed in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷的驻军

detailed_translations.english: soldiers in an organized group
if a group of people troop somewhere, they walk there together in a way that shows they are tired or bored

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: trouble
trans: n. 麻烦；烦恼；故障；动乱

sentences.english: Recent stock market losses point to trouble ahead.
sentences.chinese: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: problems or difficulties
to say something or ask someone to do something which may use or waste their time or upset them

name: truly
trans: adv. 真实地，不假；真诚地

sentences.english: His work is truly original.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品确实十分独特。

sentences.english: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
sentences.chinese: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。

sentences.english: a truly great work of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

name: trust
trans: n. 信任，信赖；责任；托拉斯

sentences.english: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.english: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.english: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.english: I just don’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.english: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

detailed_translations.english: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

name: try
trans: n. 尝试；努力；试验

sentences.english: Let’s have a rest and then we’ll try again.
sentences.chinese: 我们休息一下，然后再试。

sentences.english: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
sentences.chinese: 我试了各种方法减肥，但都没有成功。

sentences.english: I tried and tried (= kept making an effort ) and eventually I was offered a job.
sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.english: Try as he might (= as hard as he could ) , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验
detailed_translations.english: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
an attempt to do something

name: tsunami
trans: n. 海啸

sentences.english: You see this in the faces of tsunami and earthquake survivors on television.
sentences.chinese: 你能从电视上海啸和地震的生还者的脸上看到这点。

sentences.english: They urged other town residents unaffected by the quake and tsunami to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 他们敦促其他没有受到地震和海啸影响的城镇居民也这样做。

sentences.english: But I am lucky because we did get a little bit of the tsunami but nothing like what they got up north.
sentences.chinese: 但我算是幸运的因为我们这只受到了海啸很小的侵害远不及北方所受到的那样。

detailed_translations.english: a very large wave, caused by extreme conditions such as an  earthquake  , which can cause a lot of damage when it reaches land

name: tune
trans: n. 曲调；和谐；心情

sentences.english: That’s a nice tune.
sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.english: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

detailed_translations.english: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right pitch

name: tunnel
trans: n. 隧道；坑道；洞穴通道

sentences.english: a railway tunnel
sentences.chinese: 铁路隧道

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )
sentences.chinese: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

detailed_translations.english: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
detailed_translations.english: to dig a long passage under the ground

name: ultimate
trans: n. 终极；根本；基本原则

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: ultimately
trans: adv. 最后；根本；基本上

sentences.english: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.chinese: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.english: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.chinese: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

detailed_translations.english: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

name: unacceptable
trans: adj. 不能接受的；不受欢迎的

sentences.english: I found her attitude totally unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得她的态度让人完全不能接受。

sentences.english: unacceptable levels of pollution
sentences.chinese: 无法容忍的污染程度

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能接受的；不受欢迎的
detailed_translations.english: something that is unacceptable is so wrong or bad that you think it should not be allowed

name: uncertainty
trans: n. 不确定，不可靠

sentences.english: ...a period of political uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: …一段政治不稳定时期。

detailed_translations.english: Uncertainty is a state of doubt about the future or about what is the right thing to do

name: unconscious
trans: adj. 无意识的；失去知觉的；不省人事的；未发觉的

sentences.english: She was found alive but unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 她被找到时还活着，但已不省人事。

detailed_translations.english: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious

name: undergo
trans: vt. 经历，经受；忍受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: undertake
trans: vt. 承担，保证；从事；同意；试图

sentences.english: University professors both teach and undertake research.
sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

sentences.english: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
sentences.chinese: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself responsible for sth and start doing it

name: unexpected
trans: adj. 意外的，想不到的

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

name: unfold
trans: vi. 展开；显露

sentences.english: She unfolded her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她张开双臂。

sentences.english: As the story unfolds, we learn more about Max’s childhood.
sentences.chinese: 随着故事的展开，我们对马克斯的童年有了更多的了解。

detailed_translations.english: to spread open or flat sth that has previously been folded; to become open and flat

name: unfortunate
trans: adj. 不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的

sentences.english: When we entered the room, the teacher was yelling at some unfortunate student.
sentences.chinese: 我们进教室的时候，老师正在对着一个倒霉的学生吼叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is unfortunate has something bad happen to them

name: unique
trans: n. 独一无二的人或物

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: unite
trans: vi. 团结；联合；混合

sentences.english: Our goal is to unite the opposition parties and defeat the President.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是联合各反对党挫败总统。

detailed_translations.english: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something
if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

name: unity
trans: n. 团结；一致；联合；个体

sentences.english: economic unity
sentences.chinese: 经济统一

sentences.english: European unity
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的一体化

detailed_translations.english: when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together

name: universal
trans: n. 一般概念；普通性

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

name: universe
trans: n. 宇宙；世界；领域

sentences.english: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

name: unknown
trans: n. 未知数；未知的事物，默默无闻的人

sentences.english: The murderer’s identity remains unknown.
sentences.chinese: 杀人凶手身份仍然不明。

sentences.english: For some unknown reason, Mark quit his job and moved to Greece.
sentences.chinese: 不知何故，马克辞掉工作移居希腊了。

sentences.english: a voyage through unknown territory
sentences.chinese: 穿越未知海域的航行

sentences.english: An unknown number of people were killed.
sentences.chinese: 丧生人数不详。

detailed_translations.english: not known about

name: upper
trans: adj. 上面的，上部的；较高的

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: upwards
trans: adv. 向上；在上部；向上游

sentences.english: Pointing upwards, he indicated a large nest high in the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他朝上指指，示意树上高处有个大鸟窝。

sentences.english: The path began to climb steeply upwards.
sentences.chinese: 小路开始陡然向上。

detailed_translations.english: moving or pointing towards a higher position

name: urban
trans: adj. 城市的；住在都市的

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: urge
trans: n. 强烈的欲望，迫切要求；推动力

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: urgent
trans: adj. 紧急的；急迫的

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

name: usage
trans: n. 使用；用法；惯例

sentences.english: land usage
sentences.chinese: 土地的利用

sentences.english: a book on modern English usage
sentences.chinese: 关于现代英语用法的书

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something is used or the way in which it is used

name: useless
trans: adj. 无用的；无效的

sentences.english: The editor killed a few useless lines.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删掉了几行无用的文字。

sentences.english: Please cancel the words which are useless.
sentences.chinese: 请把无用的词划掉。

sentences.english: They wrote his suggestion off as a useless idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他的建议看做是无用的想法。

name: valid
trans: adj. 有效的；有根据的；合法的；正当的

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

name: value
trans: n. 值；价值；价格；重要性；确切涵义

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: variation
trans: n. 变化；[生物] 变异，变种

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

name: vary
trans: vi. 变化；变异；违反

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: vast
trans: n. 浩瀚；广阔无垠的空间

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: venue
trans: n. 审判地；犯罪地点；发生地点；集合地点

sentences.english: The first thing to do is book a venue.
sentences.chinese: 首先要做的是预订一个会场。

sentences.english: The band will play (= perform at ) as many venues as possible.
sentences.chinese: 那支乐队将在尽可能多的地方演出。

detailed_translations.english: a place where an organized meeting, concert etc takes place

name: vertical
trans: n. 垂直线，垂直面

sentences.english: a vertical line
sentences.chinese: 垂直线

sentences.english: the vertical axis of a graph
sentences.chinese: 图的纵轴

sentences.english: vertical window blinds
sentences.chinese: 垂直百叶窗

sentences.english: The wall is several degrees off the vertical.
sentences.chinese: 这堵墙倾斜了有好几度。

detailed_translations.english: pointing up in a line that forms an angle of 90˚ with a flat surface
a vertical line or position

name: very
trans: adv. 非常，很；完全

sentences.english: It feels very cold today.
sentences.chinese: 今天很冷。

sentences.english: The fishing industry is very important to the area.
sentences.chinese: 捕鱼业对于该地区非常重要。

sentences.english: The traffic’s moving very slowly this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上车流非常缓慢。

sentences.english: problems that are very similar to mine
sentences.chinese: 和我非常相似的问题

sentences.english: I feel a lot better – thank you very much.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好多了，非常感谢。

sentences.english: I’m very, very (= used for emphasis ) pleased you can come.
sentences.chinese: 你能来我真是非常高兴。

sentences.english: It’s very kind of you to help.
sentences.chinese: 您来帮忙真是太好了。

sentences.english: My sister and I were married on the very same (= exactly the same ) day.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐在同一天结婚。

sentences.english: He died in this very room.
sentences.chinese: 他就是在这个房间里去世的。

sentences.english: I’ll start at the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我要从头开始。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize an adjective, adverb, or phrase
used to emphasize that you are talking exactly about one particular thing or person

name: via
trans: prep. 渠道，通过；经由

sentences.english: We flew to Athens via Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们经由巴黎飞往雅典。

detailed_translations.english: travelling through a place on the way to another place

name: victory
trans: n. 胜利；成功；克服

sentences.english: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖们在争取工作场所权利的斗争中正迈向胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

name: viewpoint
trans: n. 观点，看法；视角

sentences.english: Try and think of it from the child’s viewpoint.
sentences.chinese: 尽量从孩子的角度来考虑这件事。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of thinking about a problem or subject

name: violence
trans: n. 暴力；侵犯；激烈；歪曲

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

name: virtual
trans: adj. [计] 虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: visa
trans: n. 签证

sentences.english: I was still in New York, trying to get a visa to visit Russia.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在纽约，正在办理去俄罗斯的签证。

detailed_translations.english: an official mark put on your passport that gives you permission to temporarily enter or leave a foreign country

name: visible
trans: n. 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: vision
trans: n. 视力；美景；眼力；幻象；想象力；幻视（漫威漫画旗下超级英雄）

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

name: visual
trans: adj. 视觉的，视力的；栩栩如生的

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的；生死攸关的；有活力的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: vitamin
trans: n. [生化] 维生素；[生化] 维他命

sentences.english: Try to eat foods that are rich in vitamins and minerals.
sentences.chinese: 尽量吃富含维生素和矿物质的食物。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health

name: volume
trans: n. 量；体积；卷；音量；大量；册

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: voluntary
trans: n. 志愿者；自愿行动

sentences.english: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

detailed_translations.english: done willingly and without being forced

name: voting
trans: n. 投票；选举

name: wage
trans: n. 工资；代价；报偿

sentences.english: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

name: wander
trans: vi. 徘徊；漫步；迷路；离题

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: warming
trans: n. 加温，暖和；气温升高

name: way
trans: n. 方法；道路；方向；行业；习惯

sentences.english: My family was in a bad way financially.
sentences.chinese: 我家当时经济窘迫。

sentences.english: The chicken’s nice and crispy – just the way I like it.
sentences.chinese: 这鸡肉很脆，正是我喜欢的口味。

sentences.english: It’s worth thinking how you can improve the way things are.
sentences.chinese: 你应该想想如何让现状变得更好。

detailed_translations.english: a particular state or condition

name: weakness
trans: n. 弱点；软弱；嗜好

sentences.english: The legislation has a fundamental weakness.
sentences.chinese: 这项立法有一个根本性缺陷。

sentences.english: The plan has strengths and weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划既有优点又有缺点。

sentences.english: muscular weakness
sentences.chinese: 肌无力

sentences.english: weakness in the economy
sentences.chinese: 经济疲软

detailed_translations.english: a fault in someone’s character or in a system, organization, design etc

name: wealth
trans: n. 财富；大量；富有

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

name: wealthy
trans: n. 富人

sentences.english: the wealthy nations of the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上的富国

detailed_translations.english: having a lot of money, possessions etc

name: weekly
trans: n. 周刊

sentences.english: The group meets weekly.
sentences.chinese: 小组每周见面一次。

detailed_translations.english: Weekly is also an adverb
happening or done every week

name: weird
trans: n. （苏格兰）命运；预言

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: welfare
trans: n. 福利；幸福；福利事业；安宁

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

name: wheat
trans: n. 小麦；小麦色

sentences.english: a field of wheat
sentences.chinese: 小麦地

detailed_translations.english: the grain that bread is made from, or the plant that it grows on

name: whereas
trans: conj. 然而；鉴于；反之

sentences.english: The old system was fairly complicated whereas the new system is really very simple.
sentences.chinese: 旧系统相当复杂，而新系统却很简单。

sentences.english: Whereas the city spent over $1 billion on its museums and stadium, it failed to look after its schools.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市花了十亿美元建造博物馆和体育馆，但是却忽略了对学校的建设。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that although something is true of one thing, it is not true of another

name: wherever
trans: conj. 无论在哪里；无论什么情况下

sentences.english: Children will play wherever they happen to be.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子走到哪里玩到哪里。

sentences.english: Sit wherever you like.
sentences.chinese: 随便坐吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无论什么地方；究竟在哪里
detailed_translations.english: to or at any place, position, or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 无论在哪里；无论什么情况下

name: whisper
trans: n. 私语；谣传；飒飒的声音

sentences.english: You don’t have to whisper, no one can hear us.
sentences.chinese: 你不必轻声轻语，没人听得到我们说话。

sentences.english: ‘I’ve missed you,’ he whispered in her ear.
sentences.chinese: “我想你了。”他在她耳边低语道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice
to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice

name: whoever
trans: pron. 无论谁；任何人

sentences.english: I’ll take whoever wants to go.
sentences.chinese: 谁想去我就带谁去。

sentences.english: When you’re done with the book, just give it to Kristin or Shelley or whoever.
sentences.chinese: 你看完书以后，就给克里斯廷或谢利，或者随便谁都行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谁； 无论谁； 究竟是谁
detailed_translations.english: used to say that it does not matter who does something, is in a particular place etc

name: whom
trans: pron. 谁（who的宾格）

sentences.english: From whom shall I get comfort?
sentences.chinese: 我从谁那儿能得到安慰呢?

sentences.english: The dispute at the moment revolved about the question of whom to send.
sentences.chinese: 当时的争论是围绕着派谁去好这一问题而进行的。

name: widely
trans: adv. 广泛地

sentences.english: The quality of the applicants varies widely.
sentences.chinese: 申请人的素质差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: to a large degree – used when talking about differences

name: widespread
trans: adj. 普遍的，广泛的；分布广的

sentences.english: the widespread use of chemicals in agriculture
sentences.chinese: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people

name: wildlife
trans: n. 野生动植物

sentences.english: measures to protect the area’s wildlife
sentences.chinese: 保护该地区野生生物的措施

sentences.english: the destruction of wildlife habitats
sentences.chinese: 野生动植物生存环境的破坏

detailed_translations.english: animals and plants growing in natural conditions

name: willing
trans: adj. 乐意的；自愿的；心甘情愿的

sentences.english: How much are they willing to pay?
sentences.chinese: 他们愿意付多少钱？

detailed_translations.english: prepared to do something, or having no reason to not want to do it

name: wind
trans: vi. 缠绕；上发条；吹响号角

sentences.english: The wind blew from the northeast.
sentences.chinese: 风从东北方向吹来。

detailed_translations.english: moving air, especially when it moves strongly or quickly in a current

name: wire
trans: n. 电线；金属丝；电报

sentences.english: Please wire me when you arrive.
sentences.chinese: 你到达后请打电报给我。

sentences.english: He got a wire to go home.
sentences.chinese: 他接到一封让他回家的电报。

detailed_translations.english: to send money electronically
thin metal in the form of a thread, or a piece of this
to send money electronically

name: wisdom
trans: n. 智慧，才智；明智；学识；至理名言

sentences.english: a man of great wisdom
sentences.chinese: 一个有大智慧的男人

sentences.english: You can always expect a few words of wisdom from Dave.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫总能冒出几句至理名言。

detailed_translations.english: good sense and judgment, based especially on your experience of life

name: wise
trans: adj. 明智的；聪明的；博学的

sentences.english: a wise precaution
sentences.chinese: 明智的预防措施

sentences.english: I don’t think that would be a very wise move (= not be a sensible thing to do ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为那样做不是很明智。

detailed_translations.english: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

name: withdraw
trans: vt. 撤退；收回；撤消；拉开

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者；证据

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: workforce
trans: n. 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

sentences.english: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。

sentences.english: The company is cutting its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正在裁员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数
detailed_translations.english: all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area

name: workplace
trans: n. 工作场所；车间

sentences.english: ...the difficulties facing women in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: …妇女在工作场所中面临的困难。

detailed_translations.english: the room, building etc where you work

name: workshop
trans: n. 车间；研讨会；工场；讲习班

sentences.english: a modestly equipped workshop.
sentences.chinese: 一个装备普通的车间。

detailed_translations.english: a room or building where tools and machines are used for making or repairing things

name: worm
trans: n. 虫，蠕虫；蜗杆；螺纹；小人物

sentences.english: ...a new computer worm that disables security software.
sentences.chinese: …一种使安全软件失灵的新型计算机蠕虫病毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虫，蠕虫；蜗杆；螺纹；小人物
detailed_translations.english: a long thin creature with no bones and no legs that lives in soil

detailed_translations.chinese: 使蠕动；给除虫；使缓慢前进

name: worse
trans: n. 更坏的事；更恶劣的事

sentences.english: The traffic is much worse after five o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 5点以后交通拥堵严重得多。

sentences.english: The weather was a lot worse this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年天气糟糕得多。

sentences.english: Conditions will get worse as the winter continues.
sentences.chinese: 随着冬天持续下去，情况会更糟。

sentences.english: High inflation will make unemployment worse.
sentences.chinese: 高通货膨胀率将使失业状况更加严重。

sentences.english: Don’t say anything, you’ll only make matters worse.
sentences.chinese: 什么也别说，说了只会火上浇油。

sentences.english: The bullying got worse and worse until finally he had to leave the school.
sentences.chinese: 他所受的欺侮越来越过分，最后只得离开了学校。

sentences.english: There’s nothing worse than being robbed while you’re on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 没有比度假时被抢劫更糟的了。

sentences.english: The school’s not perfect, but I suppose it could be worse.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校不是十全十美，不过我想还不算太糟吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更坏的；更差的；更恶劣的（bad的比较级）；（病情）更重的（ill的比较级）
detailed_translations.english: more unpleasant, bad, or severe

detailed_translations.chinese: 更糟；更坏；更恶劣地；更坏地
detailed_translations.english: in a more severe or serious way than before
something worse

name: worst
trans: n. 最坏；最坏的时候

sentences.english: This is the worst recession for fifty years.
sentences.chinese: 这是50年来最严重的一次经济衰退。

sentences.english: My worst fear was that we would run out of food.
sentences.chinese: 我最大的担忧是我们会把食物吃光。

sentences.english: What is the worst possible thing that can happen?
sentences.chinese: 最糟可能会发生什么事？

sentences.english: Aid is being sent to areas that have been worst affected by the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 援助物资正在送往受地震影响最严重的地区。

detailed_translations.english: worse than anything or anyone else
most badly

name: worth
trans: n. 价值；财产

sentences.english: One of the pictures is worth £50,000.
sentences.chinese: 其中一幅画值5万英镑。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

detailed_translations.english: having a value in money, etc.
how good or useful something is or how important it is to people

name: wound
trans: n. 创伤，伤口

sentences.english: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
sentences.chinese: 护士把伤口清洗包扎好。

sentences.english: It took several months for his wounds to heal .
sentences.chinese: 他的伤口几个月后才愈合。

sentences.english: The doctor said it was only a flesh wound (= one that does not cut the skin very deeply ) .
sentences.chinese: 医生说那只是皮肉伤。

sentences.english: a gaping wound (= one that is wide and open ) on his thigh
sentences.chinese: 他大腿上裂开的伤口

sentences.english: Gunmen killed two people and wounded six others in an attack today.
sentences.chinese: 在今天的一起袭击事件中，持枪歹徒打死两人，打伤六人。

detailed_translations.english: an injury to your body that is made by a weapon such as a knife or a bullet
to injure someone with a knife, gun etc

name: wrap
trans: n. 外套；围巾

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

name: wrist
trans: n. 手腕；腕关节

sentences.english: He broke his wrist climbing rocks for a cigarette ad.
sentences.chinese: 他为了一个香烟广告攀岩折断了手腕。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body where your hand joins your arm

name: wrong
trans: n. 坏事；不公正

sentences.english: You’ve spelt my name wrong.
sentences.chinese: 你把我的名字拼错了。

sentences.english: What? Have I done it wrong ?
sentences.chinese: 什么？我做得不对吗？

sentences.english: I asked him to sort those files, but he’s done it all wrong (= in completely the wrong way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我让他整理这些文件，可是他弄得根本不对。

sentences.english: I must have added it up wrong, then.
sentences.chinese: 那我一定是加错了。

sentences.english: It looks like it's spelled wrong.
sentences.chinese: 看起来像是拼错了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误地；邪恶地，不正当地
detailed_translations.english: not in the correct way
behaviour that is not morally right

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误的；失常的；不适当的
detailed_translations.english: not correct, and not based on true facts
Wrong is also an adverb

name: yet
trans: conj. 但是；然而

sentences.english: ‘When’s your holiday?’ ‘Oh, not for ages yet.’
sentences.chinese: “你什么时候去休假？”“噢，不知何年何月呢。”

sentences.english: It could be months yet before they know their fate.
sentences.chinese: 可能要好几个月他们才能知道自己的命运。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how much time will pass before something happens, or how long a situation will continue
used to introduce a fact, situation, or quality that is surprising after what you have just said

name: zone
trans: [地名] 地带、地区（德语）

sentences.english: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。

sentences.english: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

detailed_translations.english: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way
